puerasco: <entryFree id="n39431" type="main" key="pu^e^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n39431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n39431.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To attain the age of boyhood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">youth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus jam puerascens insigni festivitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39431.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow young again</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Mamert. Stat. Anim. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pueraster: <entryFree id="n39432" type="gloss" key="pu^e^raster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕraster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stout lad</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)nti/pais</foreign>, pueraster, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
puerculus: <entryFree id="n39433" type="main" key="pu^ercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small boy</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 134</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 247</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puerigenus: <entryFree id="n39434" type="hapax" key="pu^e^ri^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puer-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n39434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that begets boys</hi>: semina, Fulg. Myth. praef. (al. puerigera).</sense></entryFree>
puerilis: <entryFree id="n39435" type="main" key="pu^e^ri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puer</etym>. <sense id="n39435.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">boyish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youthful</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">puerili specie, senili prudentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrum,</quote> <trans><tr>the prœtexta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>a troop of boys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 548</bibl></cit>.—In distinction from virgineus: <cit><quote lang="la">(faciem) virgineam in puero, puerilem in virgine possis (dicere),</quote> <trans><tr>boyish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 323</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39435.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:60:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 60, 2</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> puerile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:67:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 67, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puerile obtulit corollarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 189" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39435.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">boyish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puerile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trivial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acta illa res est animo virili, consilio puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (with insubidae, inertes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isagogae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si puerilius his ratio esse evincet amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 250</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrīlĭtĕr</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39435.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Childishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sillily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puerilitas: <entryFree id="n39436" type="main" key="pu^e^ri_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrīlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puerilis</etym>. <sense id="n39436.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Boyhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childhood</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n39436.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Childish conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puerility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pueriliter: <entryFree id="n39437" type="main" key="pu^e^ri_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. puerilis <sense id="n39437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puerinus: <entryFree id="n39438" type="gloss" key="pu^e^rinus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrinus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puer</etym>, <sense id="n39438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">youthful</hi>, an epithet of Hercules, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1546</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pueritia: <entryFree id="n39439" type="main" key="pu^e^ri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrtĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 8</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39439.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">boyhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childhood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi> (applied usually till the seventeenth year, but freq. later; v. puer, II.): qui <cb n="PUGI" /> enim citius adulescentiae senectus quam pueritiae adulescentia obrepit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueritiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae cursum a pueritiā tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e ludo atque pueritiae disciplinis ad patris exercitum profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pueritiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus militum suetum a pueritiā latrociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem pueritiam Arpini altus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procera pueritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueritiae disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>. —Of animals, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39439.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39439.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Innocence</hi>: quae pueritia est infrequens polluta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 8</bibl> (al. puritia).—</sense><sense id="n39439.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The first beginnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>, Cato Italicarum originum pueritias illustravit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. p. 314" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. p. 314</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
puerities: <entryFree id="n39440" type="hapax" key="pu^e^ri^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puer</etym>, <sense id="n39440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">childhood</hi> (for the usual pueritia); <cit><quote lang="la">scanned as a quadrisyl.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puerperium: <entryFree id="n39441" type="main" key="pu^erpe^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭerpĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>puerpera</etym>. <sense id="n39441.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Childbirth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">childbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lying-in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confinement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delivery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerperio cubare,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in childbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus puerperio Antium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:114" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 29, § 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus puerperii,</quote> <trans><tr>the number of children born together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus velut aeterno quodam puerperio laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39441.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A new-born child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an infant; children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 11, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 282</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:280" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 280</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puerperus: <entryFree id="n39442" type="main" key="pu^erpe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭerpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puer-pario</etym>, <sense id="n39442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">parturient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing forth children</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:35:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>formulas that promote delivery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 511</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39442.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭerpĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman in labor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in childbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lying-in woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 4, 3, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puertia: <entryFree id="n39443" type="main" key="pu^erti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭertĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pueritia <sense id="n39443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puerulus: <entryFree id="n39444" type="main" key="pu^e^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>puer</etym>, <sense id="n39444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 18</bibl>; Rosc. Am. 41, 120.</sense></entryFree>
puerus: <entryFree id="n39445" type="main" key="pu^e^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. puer.</entryFree>
puga: <entryFree id="n39446" type="main" key="pu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pyga.</entryFree>
pugil: <entryFree id="n39447" type="main" key="pu^gil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgil</orth>, <itype>ĭlis</itype> (u scanned long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Contr. Symm. 2, 516</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> pugilis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 22:2, p. 116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 22, 2, p. 116</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pug- in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/c</foreign>, with the fist; cf.: pugna, pugillus, pungo, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n39447.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who fights with the cestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boxer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:700" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 700</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n39447.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: os pugilis, <hi rend="ital">a hardened</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shameless forehead</hi>, Asin. Gall. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugilatio: <entryFree id="n39448" type="hapax" key="pu^gi^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pugilor</etym>, <sense id="n39448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boxing with the cestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugilator: <entryFree id="n39449" type="main" key="pu^gi^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boxer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilist</hi> (post-class. for pugil), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugilatorius: <entryFree id="n39450" type="main" key="pu^gi^la_to_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlātōrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pugillatorius.</entryFree>
pugilatus: <entryFree id="n39451" type="main" key="pu^gi^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pugilor</etym>, <sense id="n39451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boxing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fighting with the cestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugilice: <entryFree id="n39452" type="hapax" key="pu^gi^li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pugil</etym>, <sense id="n39452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a boxer</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">vigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoutly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valere (with athletice),</quote> <trans><tr>to be as strong as a boxer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillar: <entryFree id="n39453" type="main" key="pu^gillar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, v. pugillaris <sense id="n39453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pugillaris: <entryFree id="n39454" type="main" key="pu^gilla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (pūg-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 156</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pugillus</etym>, <sense id="n39454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that can be held in the hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 156</bibl></cit>: cerae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">writing-tablets</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 9, 15; more freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillā-res</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. libelli), <hi rend="ital">writing-tablets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:108:6" default="NO">108, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 11, 21, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 39</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillāria</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 75</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 17</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a writing-tablet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epig. 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillarius: <entryFree id="n39455" type="gloss" key="pu^gilla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pugillares</etym>, <sense id="n39455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of writing-tablets</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4270</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillator: <entryFree id="n39456" type="main" key="pu^gilla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a messenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letter-carrier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillatorius: <entryFree id="n39457" type="hapax" key="pu^gilla_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillātōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pŭgilā-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <cb n="PUGN" /> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pugillus</etym>, <sense id="n39457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fist</hi>: follis, <hi rend="ital">a fist-ball</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a ball which is struck with the fist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillatus: <entryFree id="n39458" type="main" key="pu^gilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pugillo</etym>, <sense id="n39458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fighting with the cestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boxing;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugillo: <entryFree id="n39459" type="main" key="pu^gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillor</orth>, v. pugilor.</entryFree>
pugillum: <entryFree id="n39460" type="gloss" key="pu^gillum1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. pugillus <sense id="n39460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39461" type="main" key="pu^gillum2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">dra\c xeiro/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pugnus</etym>, <sense id="n39461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what one can hold in the fist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentis pugillus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior est pugillus cum requie,</quote> <trans><tr>a very little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugilor: <entryFree id="n39462" type="main" key="pu^gi^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (in MSS. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgillor</orth>), <sense id="n39462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [pugil]. </sense><sense id="n39462.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fight with the fist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cestus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be a boxer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilist</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 53, 33</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: pugiles pugilabant, Treb. Gall. 8.—*</sense><sense id="n39462.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike with the feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus primoribus in me pugilatur unguibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugio: <entryFree id="n39463" type="main" key="pu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pug of pungo; cf.: pugil, pugna</etym>. <sense id="n39463.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A short weapon for stabbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poniard</hi>: pugio dictus est, quod eo punctim pugnatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesare interfecto statim cruentum alte extollens M. Brutus pugionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentum pugionem tenens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: pugione percussus, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere aliquem pugione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugione ferire, Auct. B. Alex. 52: strictis pugionibus peti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>.—Worn by the emperors, to denote their power of life and death, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 68</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">likewise by the praefectus praetorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 13" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Worn by the chief officers in the army as a military badge of distinction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39463.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a book</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll of the names of persons proscribed by Caligula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 49</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n39463.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: o plumbeum pugionem! <hi rend="ital">O leaden dagger!</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">O weak argument!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 18, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugiunculus: <entryFree id="n39464" type="main" key="pu^gi^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭgĭuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pugio</etym>, <sense id="n39464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small dagger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poniard</hi> (Ciceronian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:225" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 225</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ille Hispaniensis pugiunculus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cn. Piso, who had been despatched to Spain</hi>, Cic. ap. C. Anton. Fragm. ap. Ascon.</sense></entryFree>
pugna: <entryFree id="n39465" type="main" key="pugna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root pug, in pugno and pungo; cf. pugil</etym>, prop. <sense id="n39465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fight fist to fist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">man to man;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a fight</hi> between individuals or armies, <hi rend="ital">a battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi> (cf.: dimicatio, proelium). </sense><sense id="n39465.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator eam pugnam laudibus tulit (of the single combat of Torquatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam res ad manus atque ad pugnam veniebat,</quote> <trans><tr>came to blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnitate pugnae defessi proelio excedebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii nuntiant dictatori omnes legiones Etruscorum capessisse pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omnibus pugnis (Pompeii), quae sunt innumerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 16, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus pugnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris,</quote> <trans><tr>a cavalry action</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Actia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>a duel</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39465.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39465.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Troops drawn up for battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a line of battle</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ordinata per principes hastatosque ac triarios pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam pugnam tueri,</quote> <trans><tr>the middle line</tr>, <tr>central division</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">segregat pugnam eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39465.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrel</hi>, in gen. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dabo aliam pugnam magnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam conserui seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta pugna est doctissimorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 51, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initurus forensium certaminum pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:1" default="NO">8, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:35" default="NO">5, 7, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna inter testem et patronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturae pugna secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 33, 38, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiet pugnas juventus,</quote> <trans><tr>stories of battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas bibit aure vulgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 38, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnacitas: <entryFree id="n39466" type="main" key="pugna_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pugnax</etym>, <sense id="n39466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fondness for fighting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combativeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrelsomeness</hi>,<pb n="1488" /> <cb n="PUGN" />  <hi rend="ital">pugnacity</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnaciter: <entryFree id="n39467" type="main" key="pugna_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pugnax <sense id="n39467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pugnaculum: <entryFree id="n39468" type="main" key="pugna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pugno</etym>, <sense id="n39468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bastion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulwark</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnantia: <entryFree id="n39469" type="main" key="pugnanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. pugno <sense id="n39469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pugnator: <entryFree id="n39470" type="main" key="pugna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pugno</etym>, <sense id="n39470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fighter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combatant</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:598" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 598</bibl>.—Appos.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus quasi vir pugnator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 15, 3</bibl></cit>; id. Josue, 17, 1.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fighting-cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 49, § 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnatorius: <entryFree id="n39471" type="main" key="pugna_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pugnator</etym>, <sense id="n39471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a fighter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">combatant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fighting</hi>: arma, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sharp weapons</hi> (opp. rudes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pugnatrix: <entryFree id="n39472" type="main" key="pugna_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39472.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">combative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39472.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">she that fights</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnax: <entryFree id="n39473" type="main" key="pugnax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pugno</etym>, <sense id="n39473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of fighting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">martial.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones pugnaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer et pugnax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:8:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit> (from <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 337, 31</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius Thetidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 25: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnacissimus quique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes pugnacissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: hac legione noli pugnacius quidquam putare, Asin. Pol. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fam, 10, 31, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">galli gallinacei pugnacissimi duo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 48</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui pugnax instare veruto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:363" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 363</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39473.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a speech or of the speaker, <hi rend="ital">combative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarrelsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contentious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio pugnacior (opp. pacatior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio pugnax et contentiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exordium dicendi vehemens et pugnax, non saepe esse debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39473.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">obstinate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refractory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pertinacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecus nimis pugnax esse noluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 70</bibl></cit>: non est pugnax in vitiis, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 1</bibl>.—Of things, concrete and abstract; with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis aquae pugnax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">musta,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ferri duritiā pugnacius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">contentiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstinately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare cum aliis pugnaciter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia pugnacius dicenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:130" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 130</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnacissime defendere sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugneus: <entryFree id="n39474" type="hapax" key="pugne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pugnus</etym>, <sense id="n39474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the fist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blows with the fist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnicula: <entryFree id="n39475" type="hapax" key="pugni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pugna</etym>, <sense id="n39475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skirmish</hi>, Cato acc. to Perott. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnitus: <entryFree id="n39476" type="hapax" key="pugni^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pugnus</etym>, <sense id="n39476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the fists</hi>: pessundari, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugno: <entryFree id="n39477" type="main" key="pugno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and very rarely <sense id="n39477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root pug-, to thrust, strike, whence pugil, pungo, etc.], <hi rend="ital">to fight</hi>, either singly or in armies, <hi rend="ital">to combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contend</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n39477.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sinistrā impeditā satis commode pugnare poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum manu emittere et nudo corpore pugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eminus lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cominus in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equo,</quote> <trans><tr>on horseback</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de loco, Ter. Hec. alt. prol. 33: de ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro muro toto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iniquiore loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro commodis patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">elige, cum cive an hoste pugnare malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoste in acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis extra ordinem in hostem pugnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostem imparem ex aequo pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui contra imperium in hostem pugnaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:30" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 30</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">adversum</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ante paucis strenuis advorsum multitudinem bene pugnatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum Gallos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 114:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 114, 1</bibl></cit>.—With a homogeneous object: magnam pugnavimu' pugnam, Lucil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 60</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec pugna est pugnata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna summā contentione pugnata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 16, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 5, 1</bibl>: inclitam <cb n="PULC" /> in ponte pugnam ... pugnatam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 25</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatur uno tempore omnibus locis,</quote> <trans><tr>the battle is fought</tr>, <tr>they fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cominus gladiis pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in mari quoque pugnetur velut e muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39477.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39477.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to contend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contradict;</hi> usu. with <case>dat.</case> of person, or with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnant Stoici cum Peripateticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>. —With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare non destitit, non esse rerum controversiam, sed nominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non magno opere pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>to contend not very strongly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli pugnare duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cupias pugnare puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit> (10), 21; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">placitone etiam pugnabis amori?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressis pugnat habenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pugnet vulgus habenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:289" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam eras excors, ut totā in oratione tuā tecum ipse pugnares,</quote> <trans><tr>you contradicted yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>. —Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnat sententia secum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnavit monitis furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:284" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatura fretis pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 298</bibl></cit>: frigida pugnabant calidis, umentia siccis, Mollia cum duris, etc., <hi rend="ital">cold bodies contended with hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist with dry</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 19</bibl>: humus, Petr. poët. Sat. 123.—</sense><sense id="n39477.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To struggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to endeavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take pains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert one's self</hi> for any thing (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illud pugna et enitere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ne impetremus, pugnabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc solum hoc tempore pugnatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas, ne reddar, Achille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnaremque collegae, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 64</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnat molles evincere somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 685</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 772</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerto pedum pugnat non stare tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 753</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 196</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of things,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 205</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnan-tĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">contradictions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistencies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnantia te loqui non vides?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pugnus: <entryFree id="n39478" type="main" key="pugnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pugnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pug-; v. pugil, pugno</etym>. <sense id="n39478.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fist</hi>: pugnus a punctione, id est percussu dicitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=219" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 219</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum plane comprimere pugnumque facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare pugnis, calcibus, unguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnis contundere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnum impingere alicui in os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnis onerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnos in ventrem ingerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnum ducere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one a blow with the fist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percusserit proximum suum pugno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">boxing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque pugno Neque segni pede victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Castor gaudet equis, ovo prognatus eodem Pugnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39478.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a measure, <hi rend="ital">a fistful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnus aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:33:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puilia: <entryFree id="n39479" type="gloss" key="Puili^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Puilĭa</orth> <itype>saxa esse ad portum qui sit secundum Tiberim ait Fabius Pictor</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
pulcer: <entryFree id="n39480" type="main" key="pulcer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulcer</orth>, v. pulcher.</entryFree>
pulchellus: <entryFree id="n39481" type="main" key="pulchellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchellus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulcellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. pulcher], <hi rend="ital">beautiful little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchae (i. e. Baccharum statuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; ironic.: audiamus pulcellum puerum, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 262</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 184</bibl> Bip.—</sense><sense id="n39481.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pulchellus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">contemptuous surname given to Clodius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in mockery of his surname</hi> Pulcher, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulcher: <entryFree id="n39482" type="main" key="pulcher1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulcher</orth>, <itype>chra, chrum</itype>, and less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulcer</orth>, <itype>cra, crum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for pol-cer, root pol-ire, akin with parēre, apparēre, prop. bright, shining; hence</etym>, <sense id="n39482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauteous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, in shape and appearance (syn.: speciosus, venustus, formosus). </sense><sense id="n39482.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: homo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 40 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">o puerum pulchrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher ac decens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo pulchra!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchra juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pulchrior alter Non fuit Aeneadūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formā pulcherrima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 496</bibl></cit>; cf.: Venus quem pulcherrima dium Fari donavit, Enn. ap. Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31</bibl> (Ann. v. 18 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">O matre pulchrā filia pulchrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PULC" /> 1; <cit><quote lang="la">as an epithet of Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 119</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">satus Hercule pulchro Pulcher Aventinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcher bos appellatur ad eximiam pinguedinem perductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=238" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 238</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchro corpore creti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o faciem pulchram!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit vultu pulchro magis quam venusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1133</bibl></cit> and 1094: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier pulchra nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:486" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse aspectu pulchrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs pulcherrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimorum agrorum judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum acerrimum et pulcherrimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis longe pulcherrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrima opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet pulchri constructus acervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39482.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in a spiritual or moral sense, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor interea, ne pulchrum se ac beatum putaret,</quote> <trans><tr>that he might not think too highly of himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica paulatim immutata ex pulcherrimā pessima ac flagitiosissima facta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum et pulcherrimum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrima consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascetur pulchrā Trojanus origine Caesar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>favorable</tr>, <tr>fortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Sol pulcher, o laudande,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 4, 39: pulcherrimus exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae ejus viae pulchrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrum sub pectore vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>honorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:594" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae majori parti pulcherrima videntur, ea maxime exoptant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: pulcherrimus irae, <hi rend="ital">glorious on account of</hi> (just) <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:365" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 365</bibl>.—Pulchrum (est), with a <hi rend="ital">subj. -clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui pulchrum fuit in medios dormire dies,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom it seemed a fine thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrumque mori succurrit in armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrius hac fuerat, Troja, perire tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit> (2, 3, 34): pulchrum putare, ducere, <hi rend="ital">to think</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consider beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati pulchrum Romanumque putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe ducet cedere pari, pulchrum superasse majores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>. —As a translation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o( kalo/s</foreign> (a complimentary formula), <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>: propino hoc pulchro Critiae, <foreign lang="greek">*Kriti/a| tw=| kalw=|</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-crē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">beautifully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nobly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">subigere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes probae pulchreque aedificatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum pulchre munitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at a high price</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">38: conciliare,</quote> <trans><tr>at a low price</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre et oratorie dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:227" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre asseverat,</quote> <trans><tr>bravely</tr>, <tr>cunningly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima hostia litatur saepe pulcherrime,</quote> <trans><tr>very favorably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: ferre fortunam secundam pulcherrime, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ait se non posse galeam cognoscere, hominem pulchre posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peristi pulchre,</quote> <trans><tr>you have done for yourself finely</tr>, <tr>utterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">occidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.—Pulchre est mihi, <hi rend="ital">I am well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it goes well with me</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 5</bibl>.—Pulchre esse, <hi rend="ital">to live well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoy one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be happy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ligna ego praehiberi vidi pulcrius,</quote> <trans><tr>in greater abundance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre, as an exclamation of applause (like recte, probe, etc.),</quote> <trans><tr>excellently! bravo! well done!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 428</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39483" type="main" key="Pulcher2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pulcher</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cer</orth>), <itype>chri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pul-chra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname of the</hi> Claudii (Clodii), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val.
