Max.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl>.—Pulchri promontorium, <hi rend="ital">a promontory in Northern Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north-east of Carthage</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cap Bono</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulchralia: <entryFree id="n39484" type="hapax" key="pulchra_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrālĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pulcr-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pulcher</etym>, <sense id="n39484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dessert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruits</hi>, etc., analogous to <pb n="1489" /> <cb n="PULL" /> bellaria: pulchralibus atque cupediis, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pulchre: <entryFree id="n39485" type="main" key="pulchre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pulcrē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pulcher <sense id="n39485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pulchresco: <entryFree id="n39486" type="main" key="pulchresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pulcr-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n39486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pulcher], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow beautiful</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 44, 824</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 35" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 35</bibl>, inter Homil. 50, § 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulchritas: <entryFree id="n39487" type="hapax" key="pulchri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pulcr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulchritudo: <entryFree id="n39488" type="main" key="pulchri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulchrĭtūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pulcr-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beauty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39488.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut corporis est quaedam apta figura membrorum cum coloris quādam suavitate eaque dicitur pulchritudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinis duo genera sunt, quorum in altero venustas est, in altero dignitas, venustatem muliebrem dicere debemus, dignitatem virilem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinis habere verissimum judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:34" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 46, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39488.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum suā pulchritudine specieque laudabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor pulchritudoque virtutis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Isocratis memorat pulchritudo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the charming writer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39488.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a beauty</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a beautiful thing;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beautiful jewels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 46, § 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulcre: <entryFree id="n39489" type="main" key="pulcre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulcrē</orth>, v. pulcher <sense id="n39489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pulegium: <entryFree id="n39490" type="main" key="pu_le^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĕgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. puleium.</entryFree>
puleiatus: <entryFree id="n39491" type="main" key="pu_le_ia_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlēiātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puleium</etym>, <sense id="n39491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seasoned with pennyroyal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlēiātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">pennyroyal wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puleium: <entryFree id="n39492" type="main" key="pu_le_i^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlēĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĕgĭum</orth> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 32, 2</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleabane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleawort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pennyroyal</hi>: mentha pulegium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:1" default="NO">12, 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1, 18</bibl>.—On account of its pleasant odor, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cujus rutam pulegio mihi tui sermonis utendum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the pleasantness of your discourse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulex: <entryFree id="n39493" type="main" key="pu_lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n39493.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 54, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 20, 23, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10, 25, § 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39493.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The ground-flea</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring-tail</hi> (an insect that gnaws the plant ocimum), Col. poët. 10, 321: <cit><quote lang="la">innascuntur napis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulicarius: <entryFree id="n39494" type="main" key="pu_li^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĭcāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n39494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> [pulex], <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fleas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing fleas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flea-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:197" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:8:97" default="NO">3, 8, 97</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> psyllion, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> p. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulico: <entryFree id="n39495" type="gloss" key="pu_li^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n39495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce fleas</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">yulli/zw</foreign>, pulico, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
pulicosus: <entryFree id="n39496" type="main" key="pu_li^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūlĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulex</etym>, <sense id="n39496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of fleas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pullarius: <entryFree id="n39497" type="main" key="pulla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1, pullus</etym>. <sense id="n39497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to young animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Facete</hi>: feles, <hi rend="ital">a kidnapper of boys</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">boy-mouser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catchboy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 70, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39497.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39497.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pul-lārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39497.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A man who fed the sacred chickens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chicken-keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2456</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3509</bibl>. —In this signif. as <pos>adj.</pos>: DECVRIA PVLLARIA, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> pullarii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5010</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39497.4" n="2" level="3"> In mal. part.: <foreign lang="greek">paiderasth/s</foreign>, pullarius, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n39497.5" n="B" level="2"> Pullariam Plautus dixit manum dextram, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n39497.6" n="2" level="3"> An island in the Adriatic near Istria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullastra: <entryFree id="n39498" type="hapax" key="pullastra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullastra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young hen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pullet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullatio: <entryFree id="n39499" type="hapax" key="pulla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hatching</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullatus: <entryFree id="n39500" type="main" key="pulla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in soiled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">black garments.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39500.1" n="I" level="1"> Of mourners: <cit><quote lang="la">proceres (opp. albatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:212" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 212</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: albati ad exsequias, pullati ad nuptias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who do every thing wrongly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39500.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the common people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: ne quis pullatorum, <cb n="PULL" /> <hi rend="ital">of the common people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullatorum turba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulleiaceus: <entryFree id="n39501" type="hapax" key="pulle_ia_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullēiācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black</hi> (for pullus), August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullicenus: <entryFree id="n39502" type="hapax" key="pulli^ce_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullĭcēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chicken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulligo: <entryFree id="n39503" type="hapax" key="pulli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>3. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dark color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullinus: <entryFree id="n39504" type="main" key="pulli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to young animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>the first teeth of a colt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulliprema: <entryFree id="n39505" type="hapax" key="pulli^pre^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullĭprĕma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. pullus-premo</etym>, <sense id="n39505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pœderast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 70, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullities: <entryFree id="n39506" type="main" key="pulli^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young brood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:11" default="NO">8, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:11" default="NO">9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullo: <entryFree id="n39507" type="hapax" key="pullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">germinate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pullulasco: <entryFree id="n39508" type="main" key="pullu^lasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullŭlasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n39508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pullulo], <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bourgeon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 3</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 882.</sense></entryFree>
pullulo: <entryFree id="n39509" type="main" key="pullu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. pullulus]. </sense><sense id="n39509.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39509.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">pullulat ab radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo laetius pullulent (vites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.— Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot pullulat atra colubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 329</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39509.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullulare incipiebat luxuria,</quote> <trans><tr>to spread</tr>, <tr>grow</tr>, <tr>increase</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors nascentium obitorum loco pullulat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. 23, p. 68, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Cath. Eccl. Un. 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39509.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras Venerem aliam pullulasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperiatur terra, et pullulet salvatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pullulus: <entryFree id="n39510" type="main" key="pullu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39510.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A young animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young dove</hi>, etc.; as a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">dove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chick</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 577</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39510.1" n="II" level="1"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young twig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39511" type="main" key="pullu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. pullus</etym>, <sense id="n39511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pullus: <entryFree id="n39512" type="main" key="pullus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pu-, to beget; cf. puer; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pw=los</foreign>; Engl. foal</etym>. <sense id="n39512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A young animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foal</hi> (cf. fetus): <cit><quote lang="la">asininus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:29:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onagrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glirium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinacei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciconiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ovis pulli orti,</quote> <trans><tr>chicks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinam, et pullum filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39512.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a young fowl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chicken</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli implumes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the sacred chickens</hi>, used in divination: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cavea liberati pulli non pascerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39512.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39512.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n39512.4" n="1" level="3"> As a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">dove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus pullus passer, mea columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strabonem Appellat paetum paeter, et pullum, male parvus Si cui filius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 1</bibl> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n39512.5" n="2" level="3"> Pullus milvinus, qs. <hi rend="ital">young kite</hi>, of an avaricious person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39512.6" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">a sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young twig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39513" type="hapax" key="pullus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [for purulus, from purus], <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>: veste pullā candidi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 368, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39514" type="main" key="pullus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pullus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">pello/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n39514.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dark-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackish-gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus superiore parte pulla, ventre albo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra terra, quam pullam vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">24: color lanae pullus atque fuscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne maculis infuscet vellera pullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <trans><tr>dusky</tr>, <tr>dark-green</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C, 1, 25, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 46</bibl></cit>.—ESD. freq.: pulla vestis, <hi rend="ital">a dark-gray garment</hi> (of dark-gray or undyed wool, the dress of mourners and of the lower orders), of mourners, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 33</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called toga pulla, not worn at funeral repasts,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 31</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pullum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dark - gray garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullo amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:45" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulla decent niveas (puellas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 189</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39514.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39514.2" n="a" level="4"> In allusion to the clothing of the poor: <cit><quote lang="la">pulla paupertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PULP" /> 26; <cit><quote lang="la">80: ipse praetor cum tunicā pullā sedere solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: non possum togam praetextam sperare, cum exordium pullum videam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a bad beginning cannot make a good ending</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39514.3" n="b" level="4"> Of language: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>the vulgar speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:26:33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 26, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39514.4" n="c" level="4"> (From mourning attire.) <hi rend="ital">Sad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorrowful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mournful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi lanificae ducunt non pulla sorores stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:58:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nere stamina pulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:246" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmentaris: <entryFree id="n39515" type="main" key="pulmenta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmentāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulmentum</etym>, <sense id="n39515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a relish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmentarium: <entryFree id="n39516" type="main" key="pulmenta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmentārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39516.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing eaten with bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a relish</hi> (fruit, salt, mustard, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 56</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:22:section=108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 22, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 17, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 41, § 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39516.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39516.2" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the feed</hi> of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39516.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Food</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu pulmentaria quaere Sudando,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seek an appetite by exercise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmentum: <entryFree id="n39517" type="main" key="pulmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from pulpamentum, from pulpa</etym>. <sense id="n39517.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing eaten with bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sauce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relish</hi> (fruit, vegetables, salt, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 227, 19; 10, p. 244, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39517.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboribus empta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in singula pulmenta,</quote> <trans><tr>into separate portions</tr>, <tr>bits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmo: <entryFree id="n39518" type="main" key="pulmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">pleu/mwn</foreign>, for <foreign lang="greek">pneu/mwn</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n39518.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lung;</hi> and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmones,</quote> <trans><tr>the two lobes of the lungs</tr>, <tr>the lungs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 27</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Very important in haruspicy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 622</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:548" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 548</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39518.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a marine animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-lung</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:359" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 35, 85, § 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:102" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 32, § 102</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, in allusion to its dulness: pulmon'es, qui perhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmonaceus: <entryFree id="n39519" type="main" key="pulmo_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmōnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulmo</etym>, <sense id="n39519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the lungs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good for the lungs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmonarius: <entryFree id="n39520" type="main" key="pulmo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39520.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Diseased in the lungs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consumptive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis, sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:7" default="NO">7, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39520.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Beneficial to the lungs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curative of the lungs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmoneus: <entryFree id="n39521" type="main" key="pulmo_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39521.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the lungs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulmonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmoneum vomitum vomere,</quote> <trans><tr>to vomit up the lungs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39521.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swelling like the lungs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spongy</hi>: pedes, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 21</bibl> (al. pulmon'es): <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulmunculus: <entryFree id="n39522" type="main" key="pulmuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulmuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lunglike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleshy excrescence</hi> on the bodies of animals, e. g. on the camel's hoofs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the feet or backs of other animals,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulpa: <entryFree id="n39523" type="main" key="pulpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n39523.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the fleshy portion of animal bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solid flesh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus non inter nervos et pulpas, sed in visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulpam voras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulpa est caro sine pinguedine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39523.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39523.2" n="A" level="2"> (Cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/rc</foreign>, of sensuality.) Scelerata, i. e. <hi rend="ital">corrupt human nature</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:62" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39523.3" n="B" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">plebeiam numeros docere pulpam,</quote> <trans><tr>common people</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39523.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fleshy part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulp</hi> of fruit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 74" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39523.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The pith</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulpamen: <entryFree id="n39524" type="main" key="pulpa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pulpa</etym>, <sense id="n39524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a relish</hi> eaten with bread (for the usual pulpamentum and pulmentum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pulpamentum: <entryFree id="n39525" type="main" key="pulpa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39525.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fleshy part of animals</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">the meat</hi>, e. g. of fishes, Plin 9, 15, 18, § 48.—</sense><sense id="n39525.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food prepared mainly from bits of meat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tidbits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis vellem aliquid pulpamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ... cubile est terra, pulpamentum fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus tute es et pulpamentum quaeris?</quote> <trans><tr>you are a hare yourself</tr>, <tr>and are you hunting game?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; v. lepus: ego semper apros occido, sed alter semper utitur pulpamento, <hi rend="ital">I do the shooting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but he gets the game; I shake the bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but another catches the bird</hi>, Diocl. ap. Vop. Numer. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <pb n="1490" /> <cb n="PULS" /></sense></entryFree>
pulpito: <entryFree id="n39526" type="main" key="pulpi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pulpitum</etym>, <sense id="n39526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to board over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with boards</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulpitum: <entryFree id="n39527" type="main" key="pulpi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>, <sense id="n39527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staging</hi> made of boards, <hi rend="ital">a scaffold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulpit</hi>, for public representations, lectures, disputations; and esp. as <hi rend="ital">a stage</hi> for actors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">percurrit pulpita socco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 215</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicis instravit pulpita tignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 279</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 15</bibl> (5, 1, 16): <cit><quote lang="la">longa per angustos figamus pulpita vicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:174" default="NO">3, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vati, quem pulpita pascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:256" default="NO">14, 256</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibria scaenā et pulpito digna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:25:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 25, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pulpo: <entryFree id="n39528" type="main" key="pulpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter the natural cry of the vulture</hi>, Auct. Philom. 27.</sense></entryFree>
pulposus: <entryFree id="n39529" type="main" key="pulpo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulpōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulpa</etym>, <sense id="n39529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga pulposis torulis obesa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puls: <entryFree id="n39530" type="main" key="puls"><orth extent="full" lang="la">puls</orth>, <itype>pultis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">po/ltos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thick pap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pottage</hi> made of meal, pulse, etc., the primitive food of the Romans before they became acquainted with bread; <cit><quote lang="la">it was also used at sacrifices, and as food for the sacred chickens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur tam puls ignota, Graeciae fuisse quam Italiae polenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:170" default="NO">14, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:8:2" default="NO">13, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pulsabulum: <entryFree id="n39531" type="main" key="pulsa_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pulso</etym>, <sense id="n39531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement with which the strings of a musical instrument are struck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually called</hi> pecten or plectrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 351, 10</bibl> (dub.; al. quassabulum); <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulsatio: <entryFree id="n39532" type="main" key="pulsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39532.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39532.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forcible violation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulsator: <entryFree id="n39533" type="main" key="pulsa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:694" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 694</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulsio: <entryFree id="n39534" type="main" key="pulsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pello</etym>, <sense id="n39534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulso: <entryFree id="n39535" type="main" key="pulso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n39535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. pulsarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 931</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi> (cf.: tundo, ferio, pello). </sense><sense id="n39535.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pulsetur agiteturque incursione atomorum sempiternā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semine in pila pulsato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictores ad pulsandos verberandosque homines exercitatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsari alios et verberari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">66: pulsatus parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos pulsasse dicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu pulsas, ego vapulo tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:289" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <trans><tr>to knock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ostiatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 448</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pulso alone: pulsate, et aperietur vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum ter pede,</quote> <trans><tr>to stamp upon the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:330" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gyrum pulsat equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:13:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem pede libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata choreis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 381</bibl></cit>.—Of military engines: <cit><quote lang="la">ariete muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ariete turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:696" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 696</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:643" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspide portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:565" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsabant turrim ariete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia Leptitana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of musical instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">chordas digitis et pectine eburno,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike</tr>, <tr>play upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:139" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectine nervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 62</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsant arva ligones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 529</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervo pulsante sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 313</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39535.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse arduus altaque pulsat Sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 619</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:450" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 450</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasto qui vertice nubila pulsat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:149" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 149</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ululatus pulsat aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 625</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39535.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39535.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to urge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drive on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set in violent motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormientium animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa in unum locum confluunt, quae meum pectus pulsant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae te vecordia pulsat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda pavor pulsans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G, 3, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curru Phoebe medium pulsabat Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">variā meritos formidine pulsant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:390" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes rumoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> p. 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia pulsat pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 134" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:249" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 249</bibl></cit>; cf.: astra <cb n="PULV" /> querelis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">51: superos vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1671" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1671</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39535.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39535.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To attack</hi> before a tribunal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to arraign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex contractu ejus obligatus, pro quo pulsabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non imponitur necessitas aliis pulsantibus respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39535.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsari crimine falso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusta Tartara,</quote> <trans><tr>to accuse</tr>, <tr>charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud principis aures existimationem viri fortis invidiā gravi pulsarent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39535.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put out of the way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:15:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 15, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 465</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39535.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsatos infecto foedere divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsatae majestatis imperii reus,</quote> <trans><tr>of treason</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulsuosus: <entryFree id="n39536" type="main" key="pulsu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. pulsus</etym>, <sense id="n39536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of blows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10" default="NO">5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulsus: <entryFree id="n39537" type="main" key="pulsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39538" type="main" key="pulsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pello</etym>, <sense id="n39538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamping; a push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39538.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsu externo agitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the stroke of the oars</tr>, <tr>rowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus seni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a galley of six banks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 487</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <trans><tr>the trampling of feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 445</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 722</bibl>: palmarum, Laber ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 151, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae,</quote> <trans><tr>a striking</tr>, <tr>playing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:667" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>an earthquake</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.: pulsus venarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the beating of the pulse</tr>, <tr>the pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire pulsus venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsum venarum attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arteriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 219</bibl></cit>; and so pulsus alone (sc. venarum), <hi rend="ital">the pulse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus densior, celer, fluctuans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14:92" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 14, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilis, densus, formicalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febricitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 10, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n39538.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">impulse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive externus et adventicius pulsus animus dormientium commovet, sive, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:61:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 61, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla enim species cogitari potest nisi pulsu imaginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus quatitur et afficitur motibus pulsibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pultarius: <entryFree id="n39539" type="main" key="pulta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>puls; orig. a vessel for pottage; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n39539.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel</hi> for various uses, e. g. for warm drinks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 185</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for must,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for preserving grapes in,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for coals for fumigation,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39539.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cupping-glass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pultatio: <entryFree id="n39540" type="main" key="pulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pulto</etym>, <sense id="n39540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knocking</hi> at the door (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulticula: <entryFree id="n39541" type="main" key="pulti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>puls</etym>, <sense id="n39541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gruel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 37, § 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulticula constrictior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pultifagus: <entryFree id="n39542" type="main" key="pulti^fa^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultĭfăgus</orth>, v. pultiphagus.</entryFree>
pultificus: <entryFree id="n39543" type="hapax" key="pulti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puls-facio</etym>, <sense id="n39543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which pap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pottage is made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pultiphagonides: <entryFree id="n39544" type="main" key="Pulti^pha^go_ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pultĭphăgōnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pultiphagus</etym>, <sense id="n39544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pap-eater</hi>, a comically formed designation for an old Roman, who ate pap instead of bread (v. puls), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pultiphagus: <entryFree id="n39545" type="main" key="pulti^pha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pultĭphăgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pultĭf-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>puls<foreign lang="greek">fa/gw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pap-eater</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi> (v. Pultiphagonides; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 83</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulto: <entryFree id="n39546" type="main" key="pulto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>collat. form of pulso, from pello</etym>, <sense id="n39546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock</hi> (ante-class.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">pectus digitis pultat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of knocking at the door, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39547" type="main" key="Pulto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pulto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl> ext. 7.</sense></entryFree>
pulver: <entryFree id="n39548" type="main" key="pulver"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulver</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. pulvis <sense id="n39548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pulverarius: <entryFree id="n39549" type="gloss" key="pulve^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulvis</etym>, <sense id="n39549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VICVS,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 250</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulveraticum: <entryFree id="n39550" type="main" key="pulve^ra_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrā-tĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pulvis; orig. payment for hard agricultural labor; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n39550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drink-money</hi>, given for hard labor, Cod. Th. 7, 13, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 15</bibl>; Impp. Theodos.<cb n="PULV" />  et Valent. ap. Auct. de Re Agr. p. 343 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
pulveratio: <entryFree id="n39551" type="main" key="pulve^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pulvero</etym>, in vintagers' lang., <sense id="n39551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reducing to powder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulverizing</hi> of the soil around the vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO">11, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 418</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvereus: <entryFree id="n39552" type="main" key="pulve^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulvis</etym>. <sense id="n39552.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">full of dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dust-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <trans><tr>clouds of dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <trans><tr>a whirlwind of dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <trans><tr>fine as dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>a battle-field filled with dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:403" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <trans><tr>dusty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ex itinere anhelus et pulvereus,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 34" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverei et cinerosi mortui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39552.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that raises the dust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:608" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 705</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulverizo: <entryFree id="n39553" type="main" key="pulve^ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to reduce to dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pulverize</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">turis pulverizati drachma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvero: <entryFree id="n39554" type="main" key="pulve^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n39554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n39554.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To scatter dust; to bestrew with dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dust</hi>: non (volo) hoc (vestibulum) pulveret (for pulveretur, <hi rend="ital">should be full of dust</hi>, v. Gell. l. l.), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 33, 39, § 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39554.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in vintagers' lang., <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> the vines <hi rend="ital">with dust</hi>, by digging up the soil (as a protection against the sun and mist): <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 5, § 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39554.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reduce to powder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pulverize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:88" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
