pulverulentus: <entryFree id="n39555" type="main" key="pulve^ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvĕrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39555.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 96</bibl></cit>; hence, also: Ceres, <hi rend="ital">covered with dust</hi> in summer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 742</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39555.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">attended with labor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia militiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>toilsome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvillus: <entryFree id="n39556" type="main" key="pulvillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>contr. from pulvinulus, from pulvinus</etym>, <sense id="n39556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cushion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small pillow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1</bibl> Mai; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinar: <entryFree id="n39557" type="main" key="pulvi_nar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnar</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">polv-</orth>), <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pulvinus</etym>, <sense id="n39557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch made of cushions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and spread over with a splendid covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the gods and persons who received divine honors; a couch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cushioned seat of the gods</hi> (in the lectisternium, placed for the gods before their statues and altars): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc Saliaribus Ornare pulvinar deorum Tempus erat dapibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram et aediculam et pulvinar dedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 53, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Caesar majorem honorem consecutus erat, quam ut haberet pulvinar, simulacrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 827</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>: ad omnia pulvinaria supplicatio decreta est, <hi rend="ital">before all the seats of the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in all the temples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 23</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">decretum, uti supplicatio per triduum ad omnia pulvinaria haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectabat e pulvinari,</quote> <trans><tr>the cushioned seat in the circus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: deorum pulvinaribus et epulis magistratuum fides praecinunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the</hi> lectisternia or <hi rend="ital">feasts of the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: macellum pingue pulvinarium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rich store of beasts for sacrifice</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1056: <cit><quote lang="la">templa deformantur, pulvinaria proteruntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39557.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a sofa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cushioned seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seat of honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy couch;</hi> of the <hi rend="ital">couch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">marriage-bed</hi> of Livia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Messalina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">geniale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 47</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">the imperial seat on the</hi> spina <hi rend="ital">in the circus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summo pulvinaris locatus cenā poculisque inauguratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinaris: <entryFree id="n39558" type="main" key="pulvi_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cushion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pillow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pica,</quote> <trans><tr>sitting on a cushion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinarium: <entryFree id="n39559" type="main" key="pulvi_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> * <sense id="n39559.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cushioned seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">couch</hi> of the gods (for the usual pulvinar), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n39559.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An anchorage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinarius: <entryFree id="n39560" type="hapax" key="pulvi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulvinar</etym>, <sense id="n39560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the couches of the gods</hi>: macellum pingue pulvinarium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">provision of beasts for sacrifice</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign> <pb n="1491" /> <cb n="PULV" /> 10, 1056 (yet pulvinarium is perh. <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> of pulvinar).</sense></entryFree>
pulvinatus: <entryFree id="n39561" type="main" key="pulvi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pulvinus</etym>, <sense id="n39561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cushion-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinatus calyx (juglandis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fissura (seminis palmae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum scrobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitula columnarum,</quote> <trans><tr>cushion-shaped capitals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>columns with cushion-shaped capitals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pulvinensis: <entryFree id="n39562" type="gloss" key="pulvi_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pulvinar</etym>, <sense id="n39562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Bellona</hi>, in whose chapel was a pulvinar, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2317 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 480</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">540</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinulus: <entryFree id="n39563" type="main" key="pulvi_nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pulvinus</etym>, <sense id="n39563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bed of earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvinus: <entryFree id="n39564" type="main" key="pulvi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, prop. <sense id="n39564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elevation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39564.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cushion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillow</hi> to sit or lie upon: <cit><quote lang="la">mane pulvinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassum pulvinus poposcisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula super caput in pulvino posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam pulvino subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a seat of honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestiorem te aut turpiorem potest facere pulvinus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elevation</hi> in the fields, <hi rend="ital">a raised border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:35:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bolstering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surbase</hi> of brick, to cover the joint between the walls and floor of a barn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sand-bank</hi> in the sea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.6" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A structure of stone in the water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which to erect a pillar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39564.7" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A projecting part of a catapult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pillow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvis: <entryFree id="n39565" type="main" key="pulvis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulvis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (<case>nom.</case> pulver, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 707</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n39565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:35" default="NO">2, 13, 35</bibl> (3, 5, 19); <cit><quote lang="la">and also,</quote> <trans><tr>masc</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:6" default="NO">1, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO">4</bibl> (5), 9, 31). </sense><sense id="n39565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powder</hi>: jamque fere pulvis ad caelum vasta videtur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 11</bibl> (Ann. v. 286 Vahl.): fulva, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 13</bibl> (Ann. v. 319 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">si multus erat in calceis pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris nebula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani pulveris vim magnam animadvortunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (ventus) nubes pulveris vehit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectum oculorum nubes pulveris abstulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:12" default="NO">5, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:174" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitam nigro glomerari pulvere nubem Prospiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis collectus turbine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem Olympicum Collegisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis pulvere collines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvere sparsi juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum caeco pulvere campus Miscetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebam in pulverem resolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: eruditus, <hi rend="ital">the dust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sand in which mathematicians drew their figures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas in pulvere describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:131" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amomi,</quote> <trans><tr>dust</tr>, <tr>powder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbonis,</quote> <trans><tr>coal-dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 628</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">potters' earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1021" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1021</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1141" default="NO">1141</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">volcanic ashes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puteolanus,</quote> <trans><tr>pozzolana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 13, 47, § 166</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">dust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ashes</hi> of the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis et umbra sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 16 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis es et in pulverem reverteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dry winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 101</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: pulvis belli, <hi rend="ital">war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosus pulvere belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:65:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces Non indecoro pulvere sordidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pulverem Martium tractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus pulvere coalitus Martio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">novendiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:48" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineris pulveres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 14, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">pulverum mole degravante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio ad pulveres Martios erudita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 83</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: sulcos in pulvere ducere, <hi rend="ital">to draw furrows in the sand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give one's self useless trouble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 48</bibl>: pulverem ob oculos aspergere, <hi rend="ital">to throw dust in one's eyes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39565.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39565.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place of contest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lists</hi>: domitant in pulvere<cb n="PUNC" />  currus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39565.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a scene of action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">field</hi> (cf. arena): <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinam ex umbraculis eruditorum in solem atque pulverem produxit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>before the public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">educenda dictio est in agmen, in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forensis pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque suo noster pulvere currat equus,</quote> <trans><tr>on his own field</tr>, <tr>within his own territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:360" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39565.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cui sit condicio dulcis sine pulvere palmae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pulvisculus: <entryFree id="n39566" type="main" key="pulviscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pulviscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n39566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pulviscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Vigilant. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Vigil. 4</bibl>), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pulvis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39566.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">small dust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine powder</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 277, 7</bibl>: si abaco et pulvisculo te dedisses, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the mathematical sciences</hi> (v. pulvis, I.), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 284, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvisculi flabiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39566.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: cum pulvisculo, <hi rend="ital">dust and all</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pumex: <entryFree id="n39567" type="main" key="pu_mex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n39567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 2</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n39567.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pumice-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 42, § 154</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used for smoothing books,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:72:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 72, 2</bibl>; hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of verses carefully smoothed, i. e. polished, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 8; <cit><quote lang="la">used by the effeminate for smoothing the skin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 506</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:205" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 16</bibl>.—Prov.: aquam a pumice postulare, <hi rend="ital">to try to draw blood from a stone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to demand money from one who has none</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">as an image of dryness: pumex non aeque est aridus atque hic est senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39567.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">soft stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porous rock</hi> of any kind, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 561</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:315" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 214</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39567.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc oppositis debilitat pumicibus mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pumicator: <entryFree id="n39568" type="gloss" key="pu_mi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pumico</etym>, <sense id="n39568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourer</hi>: pumicator, <foreign lang="greek">smh/kths</foreign>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
pumicatus: <entryFree id="n39569" type="main" key="pu_mi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pumico.</entryFree>
pumiceus: <entryFree id="n39570" type="main" key="pu_mi^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pumex</etym>, <sense id="n39570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of pumice-stone</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of soft stone;</hi> in gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">molae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:318" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:419" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:144" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing from pumice-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:57:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 57, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39570.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>not in a condition to weep</tr>, <tr>stony</tr>, <tr>dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pumico: <entryFree id="n39571" type="main" key="pu_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smooth with pumice-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to polish</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): rador, subvellor, desquamor, pumicor, ornor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumicata manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumicata frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 67, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39571.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis assentantium pumicatur sermonibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 43, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">smoothed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo comptus et pumicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapae (with myrrhati, malobathrati),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detonsus pumicatusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pumicosus: <entryFree id="n39572" type="main" key="pu_mi^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like pumice-stone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">porous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 34, § 141</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">halcyoneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 27, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pumilio: <entryFree id="n39573" type="main" key="pu_mi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlĭo</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 57</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>pumilus</etym>, <sense id="n39573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwarf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pigmy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necari a non armato pumilione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:43:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 43, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum pumilionis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:213:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 213, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of women: parvula, pumilio (est) <foreign lang="greek">*xari/twn mi/a</foreign>, tota merum sal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1162</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">pumilio, licet in monte, non est magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 31</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of fowls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">bantams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 56, 77, § 156</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 49, 108, § 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:176" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 22, 35, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pumilo: <entryFree id="n39574" type="main" key="pu_mi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. pumilio <sense id="n39574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pumilus: <entryFree id="n39575" type="main" key="pu_mi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (scanned pŭm-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 64</bibl>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">na/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.), <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwarfish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminutive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puero pumilior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39575.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dwarf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:65" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pumula: <entryFree id="n39576" type="main" key="pu_mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūmŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of vine in the Amiternine territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puncta: <entryFree id="n39577" type="main" key="puncta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">puncta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pungo, <sense id="n39577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
punctatim: <entryFree id="n39578" type="hapax" key="puncta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>punctum</etym>, <sense id="n39578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condensed to a point</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
punctatoriolas: <entryFree id="n39579" type="gloss" key="puncta_to_ri^o^las"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctātōrĭŏlas</orth> leves pugnas appellat<cb n="PUNG" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Fest. p. 242</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl> ib. punctaniolas.</entryFree>
punctillum: <entryFree id="n39580" type="main" key="punctillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>punctum</etym>, <sense id="n39580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spot</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
punctim: <entryFree id="n39581" type="main" key="punctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pungo</etym>, <sense id="n39581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the point</hi> (opp. caesim, with the edge): <cit><quote lang="la">Hispano punctim magis quam caesim assueto petere hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. caesim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Th. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
punctio: <entryFree id="n39582" type="main" key="puncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, in medicine, <sense id="n39582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pricking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores laterum, qui punctionem afferant,</quote> <trans><tr>a pricking pain</tr>, <tr>stitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 44, § 151</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">punctiones sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
punctiuncula: <entryFree id="n39583" type="main" key="puncti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>punctio</etym>, <sense id="n39583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight pricking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pricking pain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39583.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39583.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum dolorumque punctiunculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punctorium: <entryFree id="n39584" type="hapax" key="puncto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pungo</etym>, <sense id="n39584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for pricking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">puncturing</hi>, Gargil. de Re Hort. 4, 5.</sense></entryFree>
punctulum: <entryFree id="n39585" type="main" key="punctu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>punctum</etym>, <sense id="n39585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight prick</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39585.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miratur de brevi punctulo tantum incrementum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punctum: <entryFree id="n39586" type="main" key="punctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>pungo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
punctura: <entryFree id="n39587" type="main" key="punctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pungo</etym>, <sense id="n39587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pricking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">assiduae puncturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: teli, Firm. Math. 8, 21 dub.</sense></entryFree>
punctus: <entryFree id="n39588" type="main" key="punctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pungo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39589" type="main" key="punctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">punctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (form punctus, i, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 3, 121</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pungo</etym>. <sense id="n39589.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pricking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinging; a prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis punctu erutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206:208:209" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206, 208, 209</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n39589.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pungo: <entryFree id="n39590" type="main" key="pungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pungo</orth>, <itype>pŭpŭgi, punctum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n39590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> pepugero, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> punxi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 369</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pupungi, in pungit, punxit, pupungit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 131</bibl></cit>; scanned pŭpūgi, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 9, 59), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root pug-, to thrust, strike, whence also pugil, pugnus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu/c</foreign>, etc.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39590.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acu comatoriā mihi malas pungebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus quod acu punctum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n39590.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pierce into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 460</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection).—</sense><sense id="n39590.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To affect sensibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bite</hi>: ut pungat colubram: cum pupugerit, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 894</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pungunt sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 625</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to pinch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitrum adulteratum pungit,</quote> <trans><tr>has a pungent taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura pungunt, nec se superari sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:v. 177" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> v. 177</bibl></cit> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n39590.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annoy</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulus aliquem stimulat ac pungit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula illa ita me pupugit, ut somnum mihi ademerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum meum ille pectus pungit aculeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pungit me, quod scribis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paupertas momordit, si ignominia pupugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tamen pungit aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi ego, quos numquam pungunt suspiria somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 27. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">punctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pricked in</hi>, like a point; hence, of time: puncto tempore (cf.: puncto temporis; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">in an instant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a moment</hi> (only in Lucr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:456" default="NO" valid="yes">456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1006" default="NO" valid="yes">1006</bibl>; 4, 216; 6, 230.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n39590.7" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">punctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is pricked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pricked in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39590.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:45:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 45, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39590.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small spot</hi> (as if made by pricking): <cit><quote lang="la">ova punctis distincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma sanguineis punctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncta quae terebrantur acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:46:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferream frontem convulnerandam praebeant punctis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the marks of slavery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:35" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.11" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39590.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A point</hi> made in writing, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">145, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a punctuation mark,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n39590.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A mathematical point.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spot</hi> on dice: quadringenis in punctum sestertiis aleam lusit, Suet. Ner. <pb n="1492" /> <cb n="PUNI" /> 30; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 1, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.15" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dot as the sign of a vote</hi>, made in a waxen tablet, before the introduction of separate ballots; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.,</quote> <trans><tr>a vote</tr>, <tr>suffrage</tr>, <tr>ballot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 62</bibl>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tulit punctum qui miscuit utile dulci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedo Alcaeus puncto illius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Grat. 5</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">A point on the bar of a steelyard</hi>, indicating the weight: <cit><quote lang="la">diluis helleborum, certo compescere puncto nescius examen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small part</hi> of any thing divided or measured off, e.g., </sense><sense id="n39590.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A small weight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A small liquid measure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39590.19" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A small portion of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a moment</hi> (cf. momentum): <cit><quote lang="la">puncto temporis eodem,</quote> <trans><tr>in the same moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 24, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne punctum quidem temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo puncto temporis intermisso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus minimis temporum punctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi discessus a corpore fit ad punctum temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis puncto omnes Uticam relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 201</bibl></cit>.—Rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">punctum est quod vivimus et adhuc puncto minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puncto brevissimo dilapsa domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod momentum, quod immo temporis punctum, aut beneficio sterile aut vacuum laude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 54, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.20" n="d" level="4"> In space, <hi rend="ital">a point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa terra ita mihi parva visa est, ut me imperii nostri, quo quasi punctum ejus attingimus, poeniteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39590.21" n="e" level="4"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">a small portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short section</hi>, Cic. Par. prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12</bibl> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n39590.22" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">puncta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">a prick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puncture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
punicans: <entryFree id="n39591" type="main" key="pu_ni^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Punicus</etym>, <sense id="n39591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blushing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">caliculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 105, 1.</sense></entryFree>
punicanus: <entryFree id="n39592" type="main" key="Pu_ni^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made in the Punic manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Punic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punice: <entryFree id="n39593" type="main" key="Pu_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Poeni, B. <sense id="n39593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puniceus: <entryFree id="n39594" type="main" key="pu_ni^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Punicus</etym>. <sense id="n39594.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple - colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puniceum supparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. P. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. P. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taeniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:318" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae (currūs Aurorae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 607</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>skin beaten red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:411" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 411</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39594.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Punic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puniceus dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:284" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 284</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punicus: <entryFree id="n39595" type="main" key="Pu_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Poeni, B.</entryFree>
punio: <entryFree id="n39596" type="main" key="pu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnĭo</orth> <itype>or</itype> (in archaic form) <orth extent="full" lang="la">poenĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ii, ītum, 4</itype> (sync. <sense id="n39596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> poenibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1238</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">poen-</orth>), <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [poena]. </sense><sense id="n39596.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To inflict punishment upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to punish</hi> (syn.: castigo, animadverto, plecto, multo). </sense><sense id="n39596.2" n="(a)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata punimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">punire sontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philemonem morte puniit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio punito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex omnis aut punit aut jubet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 48</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo ac capite puniri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 778</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39596.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">qui punitur aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos puniuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelius poeniri quam erat humanitatis meae postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:27:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 27, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">punita sum funestum praedonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39596.4" n="(g)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">indeterm.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse se puniens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibenda autem maxime est ira in puniendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39596.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take vengeance for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to avenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revenge</hi>,= ulcisci (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciae fana punire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia est cupiditas puniendi doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam domum a judicibus puniendam putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut clarissimorum omnium crudelissimam puniretur necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punior: <entryFree id="n39597" type="main" key="pu_ni^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, v. punio.</entryFree>
punitio: <entryFree id="n39598" type="main" key="pu_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>punio</etym>, <sense id="n39598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a punishment</hi> <cb n="PUPP" /> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:14:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:2" default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
punitor: <entryFree id="n39599" type="main" key="pu_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūnītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>punio</etym>. <sense id="n39599.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A punisher</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosorum punitor acerrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39599.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An avenger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit ultor injuriae, punitor doloris sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassianae stragis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
punus: <entryFree id="n39600" type="main" key="Pu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for Poenus, <sense id="n39600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Punic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Punior,</quote> <trans><tr>more Carthaginian</tr>, <tr>more skilled in the Carthaginian language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pupa: <entryFree id="n39601" type="main" key="pu_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">puppa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pupus</etym>. <sense id="n39601.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damsel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:20:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2449</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39601.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a doll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puppet</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:70" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 128, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 12 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pupilla: <entryFree id="n39602" type="main" key="pu_pilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpilla</orth> (in the Tab. Heracl. lin. 4 and 5 abbrev. VP., i. e. PV. reversed, like O for Gaia and q for puella), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pupa</etym>. <sense id="n39602.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An orphan girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n39602.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 10</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl>, the true read. is pupula, as in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 10, p. 255, 5</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n39602.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pupillaris: <entryFree id="n39603" type="main" key="pu_pilla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pupillus</etym>, <sense id="n39603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an orphan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupilary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the money of a ward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <trans><tr>in behalf of orphans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>minority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitutio,</quote> <trans><tr>the naming of an heir in case of the death of an orphan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence such a will is called pupillare testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, pupillares tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:6:36" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 6, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:9:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 9, 13</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the heir named in place of a deceased orphan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillā-rĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in place of an orphan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substituere aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 30, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pupillatus: <entryFree id="n39604" type="gloss" key="pu_pilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">orphanage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wardship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupilage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">TVTOR A PVPILLATV,</quote> <trans><tr>a guardian of orphans</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2880</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pupillo: <entryFree id="n39605" type="main" key="pu_pillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n39605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to utter the natural cry of the peacock</hi>, Auct. Phil. 26.</sense></entryFree>
pupillus: <entryFree id="n39606" type="main" key="pu_pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pupulus</etym>, <sense id="n39606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orphan boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orphan;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a ward</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor, tutela),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 9</bibl>; Inscr. Tab. Heracl. lin. 4 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:628" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 628</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:239" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jacob. 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pupiniensis: <entryFree id="n39607" type="main" key="Pupiniensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pupiniensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Pupinius <sense id="n39607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pupinius: <entryFree id="n39608" type="main" key="Pupinius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pupinius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n39608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pupinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: Pupinia tribus ab agro Pupinio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=232" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 232</bibl> Müll. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib. 233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> ib. 233</bibl>, preserved only in a fragm. form). —Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pupiniensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pupinĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (regio), <hi rend="ital">the Pupinian territory in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sterile tract of country in the vicinity of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pupius: <entryFree id="n39609" type="main" key="Pu_pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pūpĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n39609.1" n="1" level="3"> Cn. Pupius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39609.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Pupius, <hi rend="ital">a centurion of the</hi> primipili, <hi rend="ital">a Pompeian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39609.3" n="3" level="3"> Pupius, <hi rend="ital">a tragic poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 67</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39609.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pū-pĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Pupius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pupian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>of the people's tribune Pupius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puppis: <entryFree id="n39610" type="main" key="puppis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">puppis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> rarely puppem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 545</bibl>; and 4, 132, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 758</bibl> and 761 P.; <case>abl.</case> puppe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 653</bibl>;
