<bibl default="NO">7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 464 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:525" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 525</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 29</bibl> et saep.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>. <sense id="n39610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hinder part of a ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the stern</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poop</hi> (where also the helm was placed): <cit><quote lang="la">navem convertens ad puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgens a puppi ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>astern</tr>, <tr>right aft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e puppi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">major pars a puppe nantes equos loris trahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes citae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebamus in puppi et clavum tenebamus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I sat at the helm of the ship of State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ob rem conscende nobiscum. et quidem ad puppim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 25, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39610.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39610.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictae puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 399</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39610.3" n="B" level="2"> As a constellation, <hi rend="ital">The Ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=389" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 389</bibl>.— <cb n="PURG" /> * </sense><sense id="n39610.4" n="C" level="2"> In comic lang., <hi rend="ital">the back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis Pereunda est probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pupula: <entryFree id="n39611" type="main" key="pu_pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pupa</etym>. <sense id="n39611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A girl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little lass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puppet;</hi> as a term of endearment, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">A PVPVLA,</quote> <trans><tr>from the age of girlhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3031</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:40" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 255, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies ipsa, quae pupula vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pupulus: <entryFree id="n39612" type="main" key="pu_pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pupus</etym>. <sense id="n39612.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little boy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">mockingly, of an old man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39612.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A puppet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pupus: <entryFree id="n39613" type="main" key="pu_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root pu-, to beget; cf.: puer, pubes</etym>. <sense id="n39613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a child</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a term of endearment,</quote> <trans><tr>puppet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The pupil of the eye</hi> (post-class. for pupula and pupilla), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pure: <entryFree id="n39614" type="main" key="pu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. purus <sense id="n39614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
purefacio: <entryFree id="n39615" type="main" key="pu_re^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>purus</etym>, <sense id="n39615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">februare positum pro purgare et purefacere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purgabilis: <entryFree id="n39616" type="main" key="purga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>purgo</etym>, <sense id="n39616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be easily cleansed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purified</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castanea,</quote> <trans><tr>that can be easily separated from the husk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purgamen: <entryFree id="n39617" type="main" key="purga_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39617.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">What was annually swept</hi> or <hi rend="ital">washed from the temple of Vesta</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the dirt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filth swept out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sweepings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offscourings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:713" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 713</bibl> and 227; v. stercus.—</sense><sense id="n39617.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A means of purgation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purification</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 327</bibl></cit>: aquae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">baptism</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 30.—</sense><sense id="n39617.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgamentum: <entryFree id="n39618" type="main" key="purga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39618.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">What is swept</hi> or <hi rend="ital">washed off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweepings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offscourings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cloacam maximam, receptaculum omnium purgamentorum urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae in pavimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 74, § 192</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offscouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outcast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:7" default="NO">10, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgamenta pro frugibus creat humus palustris,</quote> <trans><tr>weeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39618.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">washings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which is washed up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgamenta freti aestuantis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>pearls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanquam purgamenta hujus mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39618.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A means of purgation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purification</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expiatory sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 134, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgate: <entryFree id="n39619" type="main" key="purga_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. purgo, <sense id="n39619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
purgaticius: <entryFree id="n39620" type="gloss" key="purga_tici^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgāticĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>purgo</etym>, <sense id="n39620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgatio: <entryFree id="n39621" type="main" key="purga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purging.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cloacarum, Trajan. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">menstrua,</quote> <trans><tr>the monthly courses of women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 46, § 131</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:148" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 14, 53, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:116" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 13, 72, § 116</bibl>; 30, 14, 44, § 129; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans><tr>a purging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply purgatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39621.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A religious purgation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purification from guilt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an expiation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39621.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An apology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">justification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgativus: <entryFree id="n39622" type="main" key="purga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purgative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cathartic</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:1" default="NO">2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgator: <entryFree id="n39623" type="main" key="purga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39623.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cleanser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purger</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cloacarum, Firm. Math. 8, 20: ferarum,</quote> <trans><tr>an exterminator of wild beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39623.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animae, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 10.</sense></entryFree>
purgatorius: <entryFree id="n39624" type="main" key="purga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purgative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purgatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:65" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 65</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 7: tormenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purgatrix: <entryFree id="n39625" type="main" key="purga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purgator</etym>, <sense id="n39625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that cleanses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purifies: cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purifying</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">purgatrice aquā se expiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purgatura: <entryFree id="n39626" type="gloss" key="purga_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purgo</etym>, <sense id="n39626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing</hi> of animals, Edict. Diocl. p. 20.</sense></entryFree>
purgatus: <entryFree id="n39627" type="main" key="purga_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from purgo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n39628" type="main" key="purga_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. purgatio, I.</entryFree>
purgito: <entryFree id="n39629" type="main" key="purgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>purgo</etym>, <sense id="n39629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purge</hi> (Plautin.). * </sense><sense id="n39629.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: carnificis angiporta purgitans, Plaut. Fragm. <pb n="1493" /> <cb n="PURG" /> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 190, 10</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n39629.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to excuse one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purgo: <entryFree id="n39630" type="main" key="purgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. for purigo, from purum ago</etym>, <sense id="n39630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39630.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam a foliis et stercore purgato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65, 1</bibl></cit>: cum falcibus purgarunt locum, <hi rend="ital">cleared the place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freed it from bushes</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva longis ligonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum muribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proprios leniter ungues cultello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 51</bibl></cit>: cana labra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free from beard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:28:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 241</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi sarculo purgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 241</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">purgor in amni,</quote> <trans><tr>wash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to cleanse by stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vomiting</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to purge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid scammoneae radix ad purgandum possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is, qui saepe purgatus est, subito habet alvum suppressam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui purgor bilem sub verni temporis horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se helleboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:7:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se per inferna aut vomitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39630.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make even by clearing away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to level</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 582 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">purgare viam proprie dicitur ad libramentum proprium redigere, sublato eo quod supra eam esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To clear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermes clavo aëneo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 383</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scindit se nubes et in aethera purgat apertum,</quote> <trans><tr>melts away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic., in medicine, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expel by purging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rinsing</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatum te illius morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidium lauri folio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppurationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditatem aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succus purgat cicatrices et nubeculas (oculorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 85, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> (syn. lustro). </sense><sense id="n39630.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos ordines contaminatos veteri neglegentiā purgavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to clear up</tr>, <tr>settle</tr>, <tr>pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To clear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.10" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39630.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To clear from accusation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exculpate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">justify</hi> (syn. excuso): <cit><quote lang="la">ut me purgarem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVIBVS DE REBVS VOS PVRGAVISTIS ... QVOMQVE DE EIEIS REBVS SENATVEI PVRGATI ESTIS, S. C. de Tiburt. lin. 3 and 12 (ap. Grut. 499, 12): quod te mihi de Sempronio purgas, accipio excusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui se purgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me tibi purgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Caesarem de interitu Marcelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis tibi se purgare volet, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 9:35" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parum vobis essem purgatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velle Pompeium se Caesari purgatum, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea pars epistulae tuae, per quam te ac mores tuos mihi purgatos ac probatos esse voluisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedebant blanditiae virorum factum purgantium cupiditate atque amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:39" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:12:8" default="NO">5, 12, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <trans><tr>to disprove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 48, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">probra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentem crimine civilis belli,</quote> <trans><tr>to acquit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiam suam,</quote> <trans><tr>to vindicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae ipsis obicerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>to refute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purget miles, quod vicerit hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:510" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicujus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se adversus alicujus criminationes purgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi lacrimantes nunc purgare se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborare regem, ut purganti se nihil hostile dixisse aut fecisse, fides habeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui purgarent nec accitos ab eo Bastarnas nec auctore eo quidquam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purge from a crime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sin with religious rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make expiation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">atonement for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atone for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lustrate</hi>, = expiare, lustrare (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">di patrii, purgamus agros, purgamus agrestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:640" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtea verbena Romanos Sabinosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices purgantes moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus purgantur lustranturque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 105</bibl></cit>. —With the crime or act as an object: nefas,<cb n="PURP" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 952</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 47, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">purgā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39630.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cleansed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia pituitā purgatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatioris auri vena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 179</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n39630.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exculpated</hi>: ita fiducia quam argumentis purgatiores dimittuntur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 310, 22</bibl>, and ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39630.15" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freed from sin</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vota purgatiora, Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 2: purgatissima ecclesia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ver. Rel. 1</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">purgātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">purely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enucleate dicitur purgate, exquisite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 60, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purificatio: <entryFree id="n39631" type="main" key="pu_ri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purifico</etym>, <sense id="n39631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purification</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">laurus purificationibus adhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8 praef" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis purificationis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: purificatio, <foreign lang="greek">kaqarmo/s</foreign>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
purificatorius: <entryFree id="n39632" type="main" key="pu_ri^fi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭfĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctificatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 16, 22.</sense></entryFree>
purifico: <entryFree id="n39633" type="main" key="pu_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>purus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n39633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purify</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n39633.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luteos pedes aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 28, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicas (oculorum) lacrimationum salivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39633.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to purify with religious rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atone for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a concubitu mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille infamavit, te purifica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 6, 72</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purificus: <entryFree id="n39634" type="main" key="pu_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purifying</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purificum Jovem precatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 328</bibl></cit> (al. terrificum).</sense></entryFree>
purime: <entryFree id="n39635" type="gloss" key="pu_ri^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭmē</orth>, <itype>for purissime</itype>, v. <itype>pure</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, under purus <sense id="n39635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puritas: <entryFree id="n39636" type="main" key="pu_ri^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purus</etym>, <sense id="n39636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purity</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39636.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of wine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39636.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 17, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39637" type="main" key="pu_ri^tas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pus</etym>, <sense id="n39637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purulency</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puriter: <entryFree id="n39638" type="main" key="pu_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. purus <sense id="n39638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puritia: <entryFree id="n39639" type="main" key="pu_ri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pueritia.</entryFree>
puro: <entryFree id="n39640" type="main" key="pu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>purus</etym>, <sense id="n39640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purify</hi> with religious rites (very rare, perh. <foreign lang="greek">a(/pac ei)r</foreign>.): sacra, Fest. s. v. prophetas, p. 229 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
purpura: <entryFree id="n39641" type="main" key="purpu^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">porfu/ra</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n39641.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the purple-fish</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bucinum, murex, ostrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:125 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 36, 60, § 125 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n39641.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">purple color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">violae sublucet purpura nigrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certantem uvam purpurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:68" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">a spurious purple color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepared from berries</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>.—Like aurum, gemmae, etc., to designate any valuable object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1423</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuram marinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39641.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The purple</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">purple cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a purple garment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura plebeia ac paene fusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: usque ad talos demissa purpura, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the</hi> praetexta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 40, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus eburneus, auro ac purpurā stratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of the <hi rend="ital">purple garments</hi> worn by kings and magistrates: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura Pompeium summi velabit honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 495</bibl></cit>.—Cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae Laconicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 28</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39641.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lofty station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high dignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis Latio quae servit purpura ferro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>all kings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpuram sumere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sovereignty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adorare purpuram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the emperor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 6, 24, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septima purpura,</quote> <trans><tr>the seventh consulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia Latios renovārat purpura fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:112" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque novi praeëunt fasces, nova purpura fulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 81</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39641.4" n="3" level="3"> Of wine: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura potabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purpuramentum: <entryFree id="n39642" type="main" key="purpu^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>purpura</etym>, <sense id="n39642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purple vestment</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps. - <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpurarius: <entryFree id="n39643" type="main" key="purpu^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n39643.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officinae,</quote> <trans><tr>manufactories of purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 27</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PURP" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">46: taberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIATOR ARTIS PVRPVRARIAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4250</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n39643.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39643.2" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a purple-dyer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4271</bibl> and 4272.— </sense><sense id="n39643.3" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n39643.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A purpledye house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2952</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39643.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A female dyer in purple</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39643.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Purpŭrārĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. insulae), <hi rend="ital">two islands in the Atlantic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now Madeira and Porto Santo</hi>, Juba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpurasco: <entryFree id="n39644" type="main" key="purpu^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n39644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [purpuro], <hi rend="ital">to grow purple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become of a purple color</hi>: unda cum est pulsa remis, purpurascit, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 31</bibl> (Ac. Fragm. 2, 7 B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
purpuratorius: <entryFree id="n39645" type="spur" key="purpu^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a spurious reading for purpuratorum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</entryFree>
purpuratus: <entryFree id="n39646" type="main" key="purpu^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>purpura</etym>, <sense id="n39646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clad in purple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39646.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a high officer at a king's court</hi> (so called because clothed in purple), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:4" default="NO">3, 6, 4</bibl>.—Hence, sarcastically of Gabinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpureo: <entryFree id="n39647" type="main" key="Purpu^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Purpŭrĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpuretica: <entryFree id="n39648" type="main" key="purpu^re_ti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrētĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for porphyritica, from <foreign lang="greek">porfu/ra</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entrance built of porphyry</hi> (sc. porticus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 361, p. 522</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpureus: <entryFree id="n39649" type="main" key="purpu^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n39649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> purpureaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 52</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n39649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">purple-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purple;</hi> including very different shades of color, as <hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurora,</quote> <trans><tr>rose-red</tr>, <tr>red</tr>, <tr>rosy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubor (oris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis in ore Purpureus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureus lunae sanguine vultus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureus venit in ora pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:780" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare illud, quod nunc Favonio nascente purpureum videtur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>blackish</tr>, <tr>dark</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 21), 5 (cf. the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">porfu/reon ku=ma</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39649.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39649.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clothed in purple</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for purpuratus): <cit><quote lang="la">tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:8 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureus pennis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>with purple feathers upon his helmet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39649.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Brilliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">olores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:252" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:148" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes (i. e. oculi),</quote> <trans><tr>beautiful eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver, Col. poët. 10, 256: bracchia purpurea candidiora nive,</quote> <trans><tr>shining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:62" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purpurissatus: <entryFree id="n39650" type="main" key="purpu^rissa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrissātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>purpurissum</etym>. <sense id="n39650.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Painted with</hi> purpurissum (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">buccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39650.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: fasti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the consular registers</hi>, fasti consulares (so called from the purple clothing of the consuls), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purpurissum: <entryFree id="n39651" type="greek" key="purpu^rissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n39651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrissus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54, 7</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">porfuri/zon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of dark purple color</hi>, used for dyeing red and as a cosmetic, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 12, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 104</bibl>; Naev. and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 218, 30</bibl> and 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 127, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39651.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in oratione meā purpurisso litum,</quote> <trans><tr>highly colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Or. 2, p. 248" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Or. 2, p. 248</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purpuriticus: <entryFree id="n39652" type="gloss" key="purpu^ri_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭrītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, another form for porphyreticus, <sense id="n39652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purple-colored; of porphyry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLVMNAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 128, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
purpuro: <entryFree id="n39653" type="main" key="purpu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">purpŭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>purpura</etym>. <sense id="n39653.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to purple</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make purple-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dye with purple</hi>: undas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi> (cf. purpureus), Furius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurati nimium ocelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 918</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39653.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to beautify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 427</bibl> Oud.—</sense><sense id="n39653.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be purple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purple-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurantes violae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 82</bibl>: purpurantem pingit annum floribus, Auct. Pervig.<pb n="1494" /> <cb n="PURU" />  Ven. 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 149, 9</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n39653.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be painted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi>: quae frondens purpurat auro, Col. poët. 10, 101 dub. (al. quae frondent purpurā et auro).</sense></entryFree>
purulentatio: <entryFree id="n39654" type="main" key="pu_ru^lenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purulentus</etym>, <sense id="n39654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purulence</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 95</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:3:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
purulente: <entryFree id="n39655" type="main" key="pu_ru^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. purulentus <sense id="n39655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
purulentia: <entryFree id="n39656" type="main" key="pu_ru^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>purulentus</etym>, <sense id="n39656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a collection of corrupt matter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a purulent mass</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n39656.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39656.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
purulentus: <entryFree id="n39657" type="main" key="pu_ru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pus</etym>, <sense id="n39657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">festering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mattery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer albus purulentus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 11, 13, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:130" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 105, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 26</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:26" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 4, 13, § 26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrŭlentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">purulently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23</bibl>, prooem. 3, § 7.</sense></entryFree>
purus: <entryFree id="n39658" type="main" key="pu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root pū, purificare, lustrare; cf.: pŭtus, pŭto; whence also <foreign lang="greek">poinh/</foreign>; Lat. poena</etym>, <sense id="n39658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, i. e. free from any foreign, esp. from any contaminating admixture (syn.: illimis, liquidus). </sense><sense id="n39658.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39658.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free from dirt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purae aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et manibus puris sumite fontis aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quicquid inde haurias, purum liquidumque te haurire sentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:170" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purissima mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëre purior ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>unstained with blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:450" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 450</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> from any admixture or obstruction: terra, <hi rend="ital">cleared</hi> (from stones, bushes, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans><tr>clear</tr>, <tr>bright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>refined</tr>, <tr>without dross</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 25, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:99" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 32, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 856</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pū-rum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unclouded sky</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39658.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadulterated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsophisticated</hi>: argentum, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unornamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without figures chased upon it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 141</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronarum aliae sunt purae, aliae caelatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum lanx pura an caelata sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <trans><tr>not pitched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>not built upon</tr>, <tr>vacant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 38</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:582" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 771</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus ab arboribus campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>without an iron head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>(5), 3, 68: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <trans><tr>without purple stripes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse utramque sibi per se puramque necesse'st,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 506</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cleansing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem ter socios pura circumtulit undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulfur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39658.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unspotted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spotless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faultless</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus omni admixtione corporis liberatus, purus et integer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:22:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 22, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castus animus purusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne quisquam qui tibi purior esse videatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puriora et dilucidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: vita et pectore puro, Hor.S. 1,6, 64; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 67</bibl>: pectus purum et firmum, <hi rend="ital">stainless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faultless</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17</bibl> (Trag. v. 340 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <trans><tr>that has solemnized the funeral rites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium purum ab omni caede servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purae a civili sanguine manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus sum a peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus purum ab omni sceleris contagione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of freedom from sensual passion: <cit><quote lang="la">animam puram conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes, opp. spurcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:66:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 66, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:64" default="NO">9, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integer vitae scelerisque purus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of purity of style: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio Catuli sic pura est, ut Latine loqui paene solus videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: purum et candidum genus dicendi,<cb n="PUSI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone puro atque dilucido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo quam purissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo est tersior ac magis purus (Horatius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura et illustris brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura et incorrupta consuetudo dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressus sermo purusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">unconditional</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without exception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolute;
