entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium purum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura et directa libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:59" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over and above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid possit ad dominos puri ac reliqui provenire,</quote> <trans><tr>clear gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.11" n="D" level="2"> Relig. t. t., <hi rend="ital">free from religious claims</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consecration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus autem locus dicitur, qui neque sacer neque sanctus est neque religiosus, sed ab omnibus huiusmodi nominibus vacare videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. § 2: quae tandem est domus ab istā suspicione religionis tam vacua atque pura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.12" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not desecrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undefiled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39658.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Untrodden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Not defiled by a funeral</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Free from mourning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:558" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 558</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrē</orth> <itype>and</itype> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūrĭ-ter</orth> (<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> ‡ purime, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">purely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without spot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mixture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39658.16" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39658.17" n="(a)" level="5"> Form pure: <cit><quote lang="la">pure eluere vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: pure lautum=aquā purā lavatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=248" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 248</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lavare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.18" n="(b)" level="5"> Form puriter: <cit><quote lang="la">puriter transfundere aquam in alterum dolium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puriter lavit dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.19" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendens Pario marmore purius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purius osculari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.20" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam mundissime purissimeque fiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.21" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">purely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastely; plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simply.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39658.22" n="(a)" level="5"> Form pure: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte pure velle habere dixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiete et pure et eleganter acta aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pure et caste deos venerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">radix caste pureque collecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 10, 12, § 27</bibl></cit>.—Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">pure et emendate loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pure apparere,</quote> <trans><tr>clearly</tr>, <tr>obviously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pure tranquillet,</quote> <trans><tr>perfectly</tr>, <tr>fully</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.23" n="(b)" level="5"> Form puriter: <cit><quote lang="la">si vitam puriter egi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.24" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio omnium aetatis suae purissime locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purissime atque illustrissime aliquid describere,</quote> <trans><tr>very distinctly</tr>, <tr>very clearly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39658.25" n="2" level="3"> In partic., jurid., <hi rend="ital">unconditionally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absolutely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid legare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:22" default="NO">39, 2, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 26, 2, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:186" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pus: <entryFree id="n39659" type="main" key="pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūs</orth>, <itype>pūris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. pu-, to be fetid; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu=on, pu/qw</foreign>, etc.</etym>. <sense id="n39659.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">white</hi> and <hi rend="ital">viscous matter</hi> of a sore, <hi rend="ital">pus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 8</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 21, § 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39659.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as designation of a malicious person: Titus Lucius ... febris, senium, vomitum, pus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rupili pus atque venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusa: <entryFree id="n39660" type="hapax" key="pu^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pusus</etym>, <sense id="n39660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girl</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pusillanimis: <entryFree id="n39661" type="main" key="pu^silla^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pusillus - animus</etym>, <sense id="n39661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faint - hearted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pusillanimous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pusillanimes consolari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,013:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Thess. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Pers. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pusillanimitas: <entryFree id="n39662" type="main" key="pu^silla^ni^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillănĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pusillanimis</etym>, <sense id="n39662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faintheartedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pusillanimity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 54, 8</bibl></cit>: animi, Lact. de Ira Dei, 5.</sense></entryFree>
pusillitas: <entryFree id="n39663" type="main" key="pu^silli^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pusillus</etym>, <sense id="n39663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">littleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smallness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae pusillitatis auctoritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusillulus: <entryFree id="n39664" type="main" key="pu^sillu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cantic. 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 11, 29: pueri, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 214, 25</bibl> dub. (al. pusilli, as also <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 133, 18</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
pusillus: <entryFree id="n39665" type="main" key="pu^sillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [pusus], <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n39665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra homines nunc educat pusillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villula valde pusilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia (herbae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 103, § 162</bibl></cit>: epistula, Cic. <cb n="PUTA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:6:1:23" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 6, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusilli et contempti libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Verr. 2:2:75:section=185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui satis una Farris libra foret, gracili sic tamque pusillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>small</tr>, <tr>thin</tr>, <tr>weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuimus in Cumano quasi pusillam Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus quovis puero pusillior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 163, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusillo animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭsillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: nactus pusillum laxamenti, Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aphaca pusillo altior lenticula est,</quote> <trans><tr>a trifle taller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusillum a vero discedere,</quote> <trans><tr>a little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post pusillum,</quote> <trans><tr>after a little</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 22, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39665.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paltry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <trans><tr>a petty spirit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculus ille capitalis, creber, acutus, brevis, paene pusillus Thucydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. Fr. 2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl></cit> (13), 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:62:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 62, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusilli animi,</quote> <trans><tr>little courage</tr>, <tr>diffidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:51:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans><tr>trifling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (opp. grandes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:151" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dixi tamen, hoc leve et pusillum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:43:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causidicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusio: <entryFree id="n39666" type="main" key="pu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pusus</etym>. <sense id="n39666.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little boy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39666.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a youth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a pretty lad</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 220, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusiola: <entryFree id="n39667" type="main" key="pu_si^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pusa</etym>, <sense id="n39667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little girl</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 19.</sense></entryFree>
pustula: <entryFree id="n39668" type="main" key="pustu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pus; cf. pusula</etym>. <sense id="n39668.0" n="I" level="1"> Upon the skin, <hi rend="ital">a blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pustule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruptiones quaedam pustularum, et ulcuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:141" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 13, 51, § 141</bibl> (pusula in both cases, Jahn); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl> (passula, M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39668.1" n="II" level="1"> Upon other things, <hi rend="ital">a bubble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blister</hi>, e. g. in boiling water, in lime, on earthen-ware, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 86, § 203</bibl> (pusula, Jahn); 37, 7, 26, § 98 (pusulis, Jahn); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pustulatio: <entryFree id="n39669" type="main" key="pustu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pustulo</etym>, <sense id="n39669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking out into pustules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pustulation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pustulatus: <entryFree id="n39670" type="main" key="pustu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. pusulatus.</entryFree>
pustulesco: <entryFree id="n39671" type="main" key="pustu^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n39671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pustulo], <hi rend="ital">to break out into pustules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pustulo: <entryFree id="n39672" type="main" key="pustu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pustula</etym>. <sense id="n39672.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause blisters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pustules;</hi> hence, mid., <hi rend="ital">to blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become blistered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne usta pustulentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39672.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break out into blisters</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pustulosus: <entryFree id="n39673" type="main" key="pustu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of blisters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pustules</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusula: <entryFree id="n39674" type="main" key="pu_su^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>another form for pustula, q. v., from pus</etym>. <sense id="n39674.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39674.1" n="1" level="3"> Upon the skin, <hi rend="ital">a blister</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pustule</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:93" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 55, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:173" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 109, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis ignosco ei, qui volnus inimici quam qui pusulam concupiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:167:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 167, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39674.2" n="2" level="3"> Of the <hi rend="ital">bubbles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blisters</hi> in bread, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. hetta, p. 99 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n39674.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in pastoral lang., <hi rend="ital">the erysipelas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">St. Anthony's fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pusulatus: <entryFree id="n39675" type="main" key="pu_su^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsŭlātus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pustŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pusula and pustula</etym>, <sense id="n39675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blistered</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">refined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purified</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum pusulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">argentum pustulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:86:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 86, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pusulosus: <entryFree id="n39676" type="main" key="pu_su^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pusula</etym>, <sense id="n39676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of blisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pimples</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pustules</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pusus: <entryFree id="n39677" type="main" key="pu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>puer</etym>, <sense id="n39677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little boy</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
puta: <entryFree id="n39678" type="main" key="pu^ta^1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtă</orth>, <sense id="n39678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, v. puto <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39679" type="main" key="Pu^ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puto</etym>, <sense id="n39679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that presides over the pruning of trees</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putamen: <entryFree id="n39680" type="main" key="pu^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which falls off in pruning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trimming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clippings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste; shells</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peels</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">putamina non solum arborum sunt, verum omnium rerum purgamenta. Nam quicquid ex quācumque re proicitur, putamen appellatur. Plautus in Captivis (3, 4, 122): nucleum amisi, reliquit pigneri putamina,</quote> <trans><tr>shells</tr>, <tr>peels</tr>, <tr>husk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 28 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, of the <hi rend="ital">shells</hi> of nuts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali Punici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 70, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabae, ervi,</quote> <trans><tr>pods, shells</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 240</bibl></cit>: ovi, cochleae,<pb n="1495" /> <cb n="PUTE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 7, 19, § 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 11, 13, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putatio: <entryFree id="n39681" type="main" key="pu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puto</etym>. <sense id="n39681.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pruning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lopping</hi> of trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:10:1" default="NO">4, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:142 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 142 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39681.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">computation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">universam putationem imparem fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39681.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A counting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteeming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi> (post - class.): personae, <hi rend="ital">a taking one for a certain other person</hi>, e. g. a father for his son, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putativus: <entryFree id="n39682" type="main" key="pu^ta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putative</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">habitus, actus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Chr. 1</bibl></cit>: magister, Vet. Interp. Iren. 4, 60.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putatively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Joann. Hierosol. 24</bibl>: natus, Hilar. Trin. 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
putator: <entryFree id="n39683" type="main" key="pu^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pruner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lopper</hi> of trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 63</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 45, § 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët. 10, 228: vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putatorius: <entryFree id="n39684" type="main" key="pu^ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>putator</etym>, <sense id="n39684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for pruning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lopping</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <trans><tr>a pruning-knife</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puteal: <entryFree id="n39685" type="main" key="pu^te^al"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕal</orth> (collat. form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕāle</orth>, Inscr. Ann. 16, p. Chr. n. ap. Orell. 4517), <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>puteus</etym>. <sense id="n39685.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stone curb round the mouth of a well</hi>: puteal, <foreign lang="greek">peristo/mion fre/atos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">putealia sigillata duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39685.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a similar curb placed round any spot.</hi> Thus, at Rome, the Puteal, <hi rend="ital">erected in the Comitium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commemorate the cutting of a whetstone with a razor by the augur Attus Navius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the</hi> Arcus Fabianus. It was subsequently restored by Scribonius Libo, and was called also Puteal Libonis. Money matters were here transacted. According to others, the Puteal of Libo was different from that of Attus Navius: <cit><quote lang="la">impositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 561</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:49" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putealis: <entryFree id="n39686" type="main" key="pu^te^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>well-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:391" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 391</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:20:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 1, 20, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <trans><tr>of spring-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 259</bibl></cit>; cf. puteanus.</sense></entryFree>
puteanus: <entryFree id="n39687" type="main" key="pu^te^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>well-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:26:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putearius: <entryFree id="n39688" type="main" key="pu^te^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a well-digger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 1</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
putefactus: <entryFree id="n39689" type="main" key="pute^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">putĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. putrefacio.</entryFree>
puteo: <entryFree id="n39690" type="main" key="pu_te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (no <sense id="n39690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root pu-, to stink; cf. pus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pu=on</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n39690.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stink</hi> (cf. putesco), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 545, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">putet aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putere diurno mero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39690.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 67</bibl> (al. putrent).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pū-tens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aldh.</author> Laud. Virg. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 186" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puteoli: <entryFree id="n39691" type="main" key="Pu^te^o^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŭtĕŏli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the coast of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Baiœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having mineral springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite resort of the Romans</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Puzzuoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 35</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39691.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŭtĕŏlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Puteoli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Puteolan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <trans><tr>volcanic ashes of Puteoli</tr>, <tr>Pozzuolana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:167" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 13, 47, § 167</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: </sense><sense id="n39691.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŭtĕŏlā-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a country-seat of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Puteoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39691.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a blue pigment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39691.4" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pŭtĕŏlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Puteoli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Puteolans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puter: <entryFree id="n39692" type="main" key="pu^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^tris</orth>, <itype>tris, tre</itype>, <sense id="n39692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> [puteo], <hi rend="ital">rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39692.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus puter,</quote> <trans><tr>fetid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19, 43</bibl></cit> (3, 20, 7): fanum, <hi rend="ital">mouldering</hi> from age, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <trans><tr>rotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervent examina putri De bove,</quote> <trans><tr>rotten</tr>, <tr>putrefying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:379" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora cicatricibus putria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ulcus magis putre est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putres artus et tabida cruore manantia membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:464" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 464</bibl></cit>: cadavera, putri <cb n="PUTO" /> liquentia tabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:643" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 643</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n39692.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crumbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flabby</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">glaeba,</quote> <trans><tr>crumbling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:126" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 830</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager pinguis ac putris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>friable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 39</bibl></cit> (48), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">mammae,</quote> <trans><tr>flabby</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>languishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 36, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille in Venerem est putris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima, i. q. senilis,</quote> <trans><tr>withered</tr>, <tr>old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 67.</sense></entryFree>
putesco: <entryFree id="n39693" type="main" key="pu_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtesco</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtisco</orth>, <itype>pūtŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n39693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [puteo], <hi rend="ital">to rot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si minus idoneae tempestates sint consecutae, putescere semina soleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:34:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Ajax putescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl> (al. putrescit): <cit><quote lang="la">non aliā (muriā) quam qua Byzantia putuit orca,</quote> <trans><tr>has become soaked</tr>, <tr>imbued with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
puteum: <entryFree id="n39694" type="main" key="pu^te^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. puteus <sense id="n39694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
puteus: <entryFree id="n39695" type="main" key="pu^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n39695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form of the <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 4</bibl>) [root pu-, to cleanse; whence also purus, putus, purgo], <hi rend="ital">a well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex puteis jugibus aquam calidam trahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 50, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines se in puteos abjecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:127" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 43, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">putei perennes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum vitare patentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 135</bibl></cit> et saep. —Of <hi rend="ital">a cistern</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in puteum conicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39695.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 231</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for storing grain in,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in mines,</quote> <trans><tr>a pit</tr>, <tr>shaft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 31, § 95</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">an air-shaft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">air-hole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a dungeon</hi> for slaves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
puticuli: <entryFree id="n39696" type="main" key="pu^ti^cu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĭcŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puteus, a well-hole</etym>, <sense id="n39696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gravepits</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the subterranean burying-places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Esquiline Hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the poor and for slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 25</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=216" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 216</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
putide: <entryFree id="n39697" type="main" key="pu_ti^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. putidus <sense id="n39697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
putidiusculus: <entryFree id="n39698" type="hapax" key="pu_ti^di^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĭdĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [putidior], <hi rend="ital">somewhat more disgusting;</hi> of discourse, <hi rend="ital">rather more tedious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troublesome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putidulus: <entryFree id="n39699" type="main" key="pu_ti^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n39699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [putidus], <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi> in behavior or speech; <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:20:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macr. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putidus: <entryFree id="n39700" type="main" key="pu_ti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puteo</etym>, <sense id="n39700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetid</hi> (syn. foetidus). </sense><sense id="n39700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:50:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 50, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: frons, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 55</bibl>: uvae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 125</bibl></cit>: putidae naves et sentinosae, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 152:26" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 152, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries pictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 152:28" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 152, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39700.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39700.3" n="A" level="2"> In contemptuous lang., of <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withered</hi> persons: <cit><quote lang="la">homo putide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moecha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 43, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putidius cerebrum,</quote> <trans><tr>more withered</tr>, <tr>rotten</tr>, <tr>addled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39700.4" n="B" level="2"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam Demosthenes exagitetur ut putidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molesta et putida videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae neque expressae neque oppressae, ne aut obscurum esset aut putidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne putidum sit scribere ad te, quam sim occupatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatio putidissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">disgustingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo exprimi litteras putidius, nolo obscurari neglegentius,</quote> <trans><tr>too precisely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putillus: <entryFree id="n39701" type="main" key="pu^tillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. putus</etym>, <sense id="n39701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little boy; a little girl; a child;</hi> a word of endearment <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putisco: <entryFree id="n39702" type="main" key="pu^tisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. putesco.</entryFree>
puto: <entryFree id="n39703" type="main" key="pu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root pu, to cleanse; whence putus, puteus, purus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n39703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse</hi> (in the lit. sense very rare; in the trop. very freq.). </sense><sense id="n39703.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39703.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vellus lavare ac putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: pensa lana putata, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 369, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 1</bibl></cit> dub. (al. picare): <cb n="PUTO" /> aurum quoque putatum dici solet, id est expurgatum, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. putus, p. 216 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n39703.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lop</hi> trees or vines: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas arboresque falce putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 407</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcendum vitibus et ideo anguste putandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl>; cf.: putatae vites et arbores, quod decisis impedimentis remanerent purae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=216" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 216</bibl> Müll.; so, too, in the foll., the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem latius, strictius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 5, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in order; to arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39703.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: rationem or rationes, <hi rend="ital">to hold a reckoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">settle accounts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putare veteres dixerunt vacantia ex quāque re ac non necessaria aut etiam obstantia et aliena auferre et excidere, et, quod esset utile ac sine vitio videretur, relinquere. Sic namque arbores et vites et sic etiam rationes putari dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus rationem cum domino crebro putet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putatur ratio cum argentario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes cum publicanis putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo ratio putari dicitur in quā summa fit pura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom eam mecum rationem puto,</quote> <trans><tr>think over</tr>, <tr>consider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n39703.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">colliciares (tegulae) pro binis putabuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>will be counted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si numerus militum potius quam legionum putatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39703.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To believe in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum est deos non putare, quae ab iis significantur contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi> a thing as any thing (= aestimare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid denariis quadringentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:7:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni putare honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum unum te pluris quam omnes illos putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantique putat conubia nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 618</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reckon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nihilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: aliquid pro certo, Matius et Trebat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15</bibl>, A <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro nihilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem aliquo in numero putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 37</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpem putat lituram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nil puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem prae se neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.13" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect upon</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">dum haec puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo primum illud debes putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa putans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 332</bibl></cit>: cum aliquo argumentis, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi> or <hi rend="ital">investigate maturely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to argue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39703.14" n="e" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (as the result of consideration), <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">believe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitror, opinor, censeo): verbum quoque ipsum puto, quod declarandae sententiae nostrae causā dicimus, non signat profecto aliud, quam id agere nos in re dubiā obscurāque, ut decisis amputatisque falsis opinionibus, quod videatur esse verum et integrum et incorruptum, retineamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis forsan me Putet non putare hoc verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte putas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ipsam putasti,</quote> <trans><tr>you have hit the precise point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec committere, ut aliquando dicendum sit, Non putaram,</quote> <trans><tr>I should not have imagined that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyprus insula et Cappadociae regnum tecum de me loquentur, puto etiam regem Deiotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare, me maluisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae remorati dum in elephantis auxilium putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: stare putes; <cit><quote lang="la">adeo procedunt tempora tarde,</quote> <trans><tr>one would suppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies mea videt aut videre putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:18:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc virtutem vestram ultra periculis obicere nimis grande vitae meae pretium puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 7</bibl>.—Parenthetically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 49, 1</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 9, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 16, 3: atque intra, puto, septimas Calendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100, 6</bibl></cit>.—Ironically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut puto, deus fio,</quote> <trans><tr>as I think</tr>, <tr>in my opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 370</bibl>: non, puto, repudiabis, etc., <pb n="1496" /> <cb n="PUTU" /> <hi rend="ital">I think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I suppose</hi>, Vat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque sunt in omni mundo, deorum atque hominum putanda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 154</bibl></cit>.—Elliptically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 33</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtă</orth>, <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Quinte, puta, aut Publi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puta, tibi contigisse, ut oculos omnium effugias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puta te servum esse communem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:25:13" default="NO">4, 25, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:41:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:8:6" default="NO">5, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille, puta, consul factus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc, puta, non justum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1007</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut puta (sometimes also written as one word, utputa),</quote> <trans><tr>as for instance</tr>, <tr>as for example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut puta novum crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:110" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:14" default="NO">7, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putor: <entryFree id="n39704" type="main" key="pu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>puteo</etym>, <sense id="n39704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foul smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rottenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putridity</hi> (ante- and postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 25</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 872</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1101" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 222 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putramen: <entryFree id="n39705" type="main" key="pu_^tra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>puter</etym>, <sense id="n39705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rottenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putridity</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Laps. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putredo: <entryFree id="n39706" type="main" key="pu_^tre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>putreo</etym>, <sense id="n39706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rottenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putridity</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum,</quote> <trans><tr>festering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39706.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aufer meorum putredines peccatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putredulus: <entryFree id="n39707" type="main" key="pu_^tre_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trēdŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pū^trīd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>putredo</etym>, <sense id="n39707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foul</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putrefacio: <entryFree id="n39708" type="main" key="pu_^tre^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and in <sense id="n39708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype> (collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi> putefactus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1035) [putreo-facio]. </sense><sense id="n39708.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to putrefy;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to putrefy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor putrefacit deposita semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellionem in oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut spinarum semina putrefiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bove putrefacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:895" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 895</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudatum tectum patere imbribus putrefaciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putrefacta est spina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 389</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39708.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make friable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to soften</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentia saxa infuso aceto putrefaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putrefactio: <entryFree id="n39709" type="main" key="pu_^tre^factio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĕfactio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>putrefacio</etym>, <sense id="n39709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rotting</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 147" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putrefio: <entryFree id="n39710" type="main" key="pu_^tre^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype>, v. putrefacio.</entryFree>
