putreo: <entryFree id="n39711" type="main" key="pu_^tre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>puter</etym>, <sense id="n39711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be rotten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi> (ante-class.), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 159, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 159:21" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 159, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putresco: <entryFree id="n39712" type="main" key="pu_^tresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^tresco</orth> (not in Cic.; for in Tusc. 1, 3, putescat is the correct read.), ĕre, <sense id="n39712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [putreo]. </sense><sense id="n39712.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow rotten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ungulae putrescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis putrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 15</bibl></cit>: medullae, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 4, 131: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 37, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39712.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To become loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:7" default="NO">3, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:61" default="NO">11, 2, 61</bibl>; 11, 3, 56.—</sense><sense id="n39712.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fall into contempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become disgusting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nomen impiorum putrescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putribilis: <entryFree id="n39713" type="main" key="pu_^tri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n39713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corruptible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: ligna, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 7.</sense></entryFree>
putridulus: <entryFree id="n39714" type="main" key="pu_^tri^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĭdŭlus</orth>, v. putredulus.</entryFree>
putridus: <entryFree id="n39715" type="main" key="pu_^tri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>putreo</etym>. <sense id="n39715.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decayed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis jam putrida membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid in nucleo putridi fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 45, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39715.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Withered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 352</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putrilago: <entryFree id="n39716" type="hapax" key="pu_^tri^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>puter</etym>, <sense id="n39716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rottenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefaction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caries est vetustas vel putrilago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 21, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putris: <entryFree id="n39717" type="main" key="pu_^tris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^tris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. puter.</entryFree>
putror: <entryFree id="n39718" type="main" key="pu_^tror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^tror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>putreo</etym>, <sense id="n39718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rottenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putridity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
putruosus: <entryFree id="n39719" type="main" key="pu_^tru^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pū^trŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>putror</etym>, <sense id="n39719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rottenness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:205" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 205</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
putus: <entryFree id="n39720" type="main" key="pu^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root pu-, to cleanse; whence also purus, putens, pŭto</etym>, <sense id="n39720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectly pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmixed;</hi> usually joined with <hi rend="ital">purus;</hi> purus putus, sometimes purus ac putus:<cb n="PYGM" />  putare valet purum facere. Ideo antiqui purum putum appellarunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 63</bibl> Müll.; cf.: putus antiqui dicebant pro puro, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=216" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 216</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in foedere ... scriptum invenitur, ut Carthaginienses populo Romano darent certum pondus argenti puri puti. Quaesitum est, quid esset purum putum. Respondi esse purum putum valde purum ... Argentum putum dictum esse quasi exputatum excoctumque omnique alienā materiā carens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: amicula pura puta, procera, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 27, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hecatombe pura ac puta,</quote> <trans><tr>pure and clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polumachaeroplagides, Purus putus est ipsus,</quote> <trans><tr>it's the very man himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus putus hic sycophanta est,</quote> <trans><tr>a sycophant out and out</tr>, <tr>a genuine sycophant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 103</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">purus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole exorto puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam bonam meis putissimis orationibus gratiam retulerit,</quote> <trans><tr>my exceedingly pure</tr>, <tr>brilliant speeches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39721" type="hapax" key="pu^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pŭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, another form of pusus, <sense id="n39721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 9, 2</bibl> Wagn.</sense></entryFree>
puvire: <entryFree id="n39722" type="gloss" key="puvi_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">puvīre</orth> <itype>ferire est</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
puxis: <entryFree id="n39723" type="main" key="puxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">puxis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. pyxis.</entryFree>
pycnitis: <entryFree id="n39724" type="greek" key="pycni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pycnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pukni=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n39724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mullein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wool-blade</hi> (pure Lat. verbascum), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pycnocomon: <entryFree id="n39725" type="greek" key="pycno^co^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pycnŏcŏmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pukno/komon</foreign>, <sense id="n39725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devil's-bit</hi>: Scabiosa succisa, Linn.; or, acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">small-flowered motherwort</hi>: Leonurus Marrubiastrum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 36, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pycnostylos: <entryFree id="n39726" type="greek" key="pycnosty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pycnostȳlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pukno/stulos</foreign>, <sense id="n39726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">close-columned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having the columns close together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pycnostyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pycta: <entryFree id="n39727" type="greek" key="pycta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pycta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pyctes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/kths</foreign>. <sense id="n39727.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a boxer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilist</hi> (pure Lat. pugil), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 47, 48, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Gnost. 6</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">When occurring with pugil, pyctes denotes a boxer who fights in the Greek manner, and pugil one who fights in the Roman manner,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2530</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39727.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a fighting-cock</hi> (from pyctes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyctalis: <entryFree id="n39728" type="main" key="pycta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyctālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pycta</etym>, <sense id="n39728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a boxing-match</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilistic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 373</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pyctomacharius: <entryFree id="n39729" type="greek" key="pycto^ma^cha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyctŏmăchārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">puktomaxe/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n39729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boxer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pugilist</hi>, for pycta and pugil, Firm. Math. 8, 8.</sense></entryFree>
pydna: <entryFree id="n39730" type="main" key="Pydna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pydna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/dna</foreign>, <sense id="n39730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Thermaic Gulf</hi> (the modern <hi rend="ital">Kitro</hi>), <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the battle in which Perseus was defeated by Æmilius Paulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 42, 2</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 5</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pydnaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pydna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyelus: <entryFree id="n39731" type="greek" key="pye^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/elos</foreign>, <sense id="n39731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyga: <entryFree id="n39732" type="greek" key="py_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳga</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pūga</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pugh/</foreign>, <sense id="n39732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buttocks</hi> (pure Lat. nates), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 133</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pygargus: <entryFree id="n39733" type="greek" key="py_gargus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳgargus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/gargos</foreign> (whiterump). <sense id="n39733.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of eagle</hi>, perh. the <hi rend="ital">bald eagle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fish-hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39733.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of antelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pygela: <entryFree id="n39734" type="main" key="Pyge^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pygĕla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/gela</foreign>, <sense id="n39734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and harbor of Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phygĕla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pygisiacus: <entryFree id="n39735" type="greek" key="py_gi^si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳgĭsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pughsiako/s</foreign> (not in use), from <foreign lang="greek">pugh/</foreign></etym>, qs. <sense id="n39735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to secret buttock-worship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam invitare ad pygisiaca sacra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to copulation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:140" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 140</bibl></cit> (al. pygiaca, pygiciaca, in the same signif.).</sense></entryFree>
pygmaei: <entryFree id="n39736" type="main" key="Pygmaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pygmaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pugmai=oi</foreign> (qs. Fistlings, Tom Thumbs), <sense id="n39736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Pygmies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fabulous dwarfish race of antiquity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially in Africa; at war with the cranes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by whom they were constantly defeated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 18, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 29, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39736.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyg-maeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pygmœan</hi>: mater, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the queen of the Pygmies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Gerane</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Œnoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>a female dwarf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:505" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pygmalion: <entryFree id="n39737" type="main" key="Pygma^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pygmălĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pugmali/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n39737.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Grandson of Agenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who became enamoured of a statue he had made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and to which</hi>, <cb n="PYRA" /> <hi rend="ital">at his earnest petition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venus gave life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:243 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 243 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 206</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39737.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Belus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Tyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Dido</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39737.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pygmălĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pygmalionian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; also for <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:532" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 532</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pylades: <entryFree id="n39738" type="main" key="Py^la^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylădes</orth>, <itype>ae and is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pula/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n39738.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of King Strophius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as the friend of Orestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 119" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 119</bibl> and 120.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a faithful friend</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 589</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Pyladi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39738.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylădēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pyladean;</hi> transf., for <hi rend="ital">very faithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very tender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39738.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated paniomimist from Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; Sen. Excerpt. cont. 3 praef.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pylae: <entryFree id="n39739" type="main" key="Py^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/lai</foreign> (gates, gateways). <sense id="n39739.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a narrow pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tauri,</quote> <trans><tr>between Cappadocia and Cilicia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Amanicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:2" default="NO">3, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Susides,</quote> <trans><tr>in Persia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caspiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39739.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the Pass of Thermopylœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n39739.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Thermopylœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium,</quote> <trans><tr>the congress of the Greeks at Thermopylœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Pylaicus conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pylaemenes: <entryFree id="n39740" type="main" key="Py^laeme^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylaemĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pulaime/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n39740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythical king of the Paphlagonians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ally of Priam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 3, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39740.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylaemĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paphlagonian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pylaicus: <entryFree id="n39741" type="main" key="Py^la^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pylae, II. B.</entryFree>
pylene: <entryFree id="n39742" type="main" key="Py_le_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳlēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pulh/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n39742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pylorus: <entryFree id="n39743" type="greek" key="py^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pylōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pulwro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower orifice of the stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pylorus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pylus: <entryFree id="n39744" type="main" key="Py^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/los</foreign>, <sense id="n39744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of three cities of the Peloponnesus</hi>, of which one was in Arcadia; one in Messenia, now <hi rend="ital">Old Navarino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and the other in Triphylia, the southern province of Elis, the abode of Nestor, whence Pylos Nestorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 561" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 561</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sometimes confounded with Pylos in Messenia, where Neleus reigned: nos Pylon, antiqui Neleïa Nestoris arva, Misimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Nelea Pylos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nestoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 561" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 561</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39744.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pylos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pylian</hi>, freq. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Nestorian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <trans><tr>Pylian</tr>, <tr>Messenian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rector, i. e. Nestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:597" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 597</bibl></cit>: dies, <hi rend="ital">the days</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">age of Nestor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, transf.: senecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very great age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39744.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39744.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Pylian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Nestor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 365</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 537</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">542</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39744.4" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pylĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pylos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pylians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyra: <entryFree id="n39745" type="greek" key="py^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pura/</foreign>. <sense id="n39745.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral pile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pyre</hi> (pure Lat. rogus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:534" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 36</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 91; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 24, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39745.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39745.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of the place on Mount Œta where Hercules is said to have burned himself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyracmon: <entryFree id="n39746" type="main" key="Py^racmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyracmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pura/kmwn</foreign>, <sense id="n39746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cyclops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a servant of Vulcan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 425</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 238</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Hon. 3, 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyracmos: <entryFree id="n39747" type="main" key="Py^racmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyracmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur who was present at the marriage of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 460</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrae: <entryFree id="n39748" type="main" key="Pyrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyraei: <entryFree id="n39749" type="main" key="Pyraei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyraei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyralis: <entryFree id="n39750" type="greek" key="py^ra^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrălis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-allis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purali/s</foreign>, <sense id="n39750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winged insect that was supposed to live in fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> pyrausta = <foreign lang="greek">purau/sths</foreign>, or pyrota, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 42, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrameus: <entryFree id="n39751" type="main" key="Py_ra^me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Pyramus, II.</entryFree>
pyramidatus: <entryFree id="n39752" type="spur" key="py_ra^mi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳrămĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pyramis</etym>, <sense id="n39752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pyramidal</hi>: corpuscula, a gloss ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl>; formerly received into the text.) <pb n="1497" /> <cb n="PYRI" /></sense></entryFree>
pyramis: <entryFree id="n39753" type="greek" key="py_ra^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳrămis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">puramis</foreign> (prob. Egyptian), <sense id="n39753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pyramid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> 1, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 16, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyramidas regum miramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39753.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a geometrical solid figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pyramid</hi>, Boëth. Arith. 2, 21 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
pyramus: <entryFree id="n39754" type="main" key="Py_ra^mus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/ramos,</foreign> <sense id="n39754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lover of Thisbe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of her supposed death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stabbed himself under a mulberry-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:55 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 55 sq.</bibl> — Hence, </sense><sense id="n39754.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pyramus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyramian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the mulberry-tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 29, 553</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39755" type="main" key="Py_ra^mus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/ramos,</foreign> <sense id="n39755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cilicia</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Jaihān</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:5" default="NO">3, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrausta: <entryFree id="n39756" type="main" key="py^rausta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrausta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pyralis.</entryFree>
pyren: <entryFree id="n39757" type="greek" key="py_re_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳrēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purh/n,</foreign> <sense id="n39757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrenaeus: <entryFree id="n39758" type="main" key="Py_re_naeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnāĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pyrene.</entryFree>
pyrene: <entryFree id="n39759" type="main" key="Py_re_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnē</orth> (y scanned short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 10</bibl>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purhnh.</foreign> <sense id="n39759.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the fifty daughters of Danaüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39759.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Bebryx</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved by Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and buried upon the mountains called after her name;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:420 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 420 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39759.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n39759.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Pyrenæan Mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pyrenees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 689</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:487" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrenes promunturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39759.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:451" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:247" default="NO">16, 247</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrenes populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 190</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39759.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnaeus</orth> (y scanned short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 83</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n39759.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrenæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrenaei montes or Pyrenaeus saltus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Pyrenæan Mountains</tr>, <tr>the Pyrenees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:415" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 415</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39759.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pyrenees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrenæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <trans><tr>who was worshipped on the Pyrenees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39759.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳrēnāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pyrenees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrenæan</hi>: nives, Aus. Urb. in Narbone, 13, 6 dub. (al. Pyrenaeis).</sense></entryFree>
pyreneus: <entryFree id="n39760" type="main" key="Py^re_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrēneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purhneu/s,</foreign> <sense id="n39760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:274 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 274 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pyrethrum: <entryFree id="n39761" type="greek" key="py^re_^thrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrē^thrum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/reqron,</foreign> <sense id="n39761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish chamomile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pellitory</hi>: Anthemis pyrethrum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 42, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 9" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:55" default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 418</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyretus: <entryFree id="n39762" type="main" key="Py^re_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 449</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyreum: <entryFree id="n39763" type="greek" key="py_re_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳrēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purei=on,</foreign> <sense id="n39763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sanctuary of Vesta</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgi: <entryFree id="n39764" type="main" key="Pyrgi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rgoi,</foreign> <sense id="n39764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a colony in Etruria</hi>, now the village of <hi rend="ital">S. Severa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; Liv 36, 3, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 2, 1</bibl>; cf. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 296 sq. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n39764.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pyrgi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrgan</hi>: scorta, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antistius,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pyrgi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgis: <entryFree id="n39765" type="greek" key="pyrgis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrgis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-tongue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgo: <entryFree id="n39766" type="main" key="Pyrgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nurse of Priam</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 645</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgopolinices: <entryFree id="n39767" type="main" key="Pyrgo^po^li^ni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgŏpŏlĭnīces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Tower-towntaker</hi>, the name of the hero in Plautus's Miles Gloriosus, 1, 1, 56; 4, 2, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgoteles: <entryFree id="n39768" type="main" key="Pyrgo^te^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgŏtĕles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purgote/lhs,</foreign> <sense id="n39768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor of the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 55, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 1, 4, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrgus: <entryFree id="n39769" type="greek" key="pyrgus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/rgos,</foreign> <sense id="n39769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wooden tower on the side of a gaming-board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow and having steps inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through which the dice were thrown upon the board</hi> (pure Lat. turricula), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 17</bibl>, called phimus; v. phimus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39770" type="main" key="Pyrgus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rgos,</foreign> <sense id="n39770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle in Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyriphlegethon: <entryFree id="n39771" type="main" key="Py^ri^phle^ge^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrĭphlĕgĕthon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puriflege/qwn,</foreign> <sense id="n39771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in the Infernal Regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually called</hi> Phlegethon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrites: <entryFree id="n39772" type="greek" key="py^ri_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">puri/ths.</foreign> <sense id="n39772.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Flint</hi>, <cb n="PYRR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 138</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39772.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A millstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 137</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n39772.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Iron pyrites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sulphuret of iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marcasite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyritis: <entryFree id="n39773" type="greek" key="py^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">puri=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n39773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a black color</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrocorax: <entryFree id="n39774" type="main" key="py_ro^co^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳrŏcŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, v. pyrrhocorax.</entryFree>
pyrodes: <entryFree id="n39775" type="main" key="Pyro_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purw/dhs,</foreign> <sense id="n39775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the discoverer of the art of kindling fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem e silice Pyrodes Cilicis filius (invenit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrois: <entryFree id="n39776" type="main" key="Py^ro^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrŏis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrŏeis</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puro/eis</foreign> (fiery). <sense id="n39776.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The planet Mars</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 290; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 18, 12</bibl>; App. de Mundo, p. 171; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 851</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>, written as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n39776.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the horses of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:432" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 182" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyropoecilos: <entryFree id="n39777" type="greek" key="py^ro^poeci^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrŏpoecĭlos</orth> <itype>lapis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">puropoi/kilos,</foreign> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhŏpoecĭlos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">purropoi/kilos,</foreign> <sense id="n39777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of porphyry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyropus: <entryFree id="n39778" type="greek" key="py^ro_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrōpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purwpo/s</foreign> (fire-colored), <sense id="n39778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metallic mixture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gold - bronze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bronze</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 803</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrota: <entryFree id="n39779" type="main" key="py^ro_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pyralis.</entryFree>
pyrrha: <entryFree id="n39780" type="main" key="Pyrrha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rra.</foreign> <sense id="n39780.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Epimetheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Deucalion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:350 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 350 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 153" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1039" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1039</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n39780.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pyrrha</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrrhæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <trans><tr>which Pyrrha and Deucalion flung behind them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 305</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n39780.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name borne by Achilles when clothed as a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 96" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39780.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Lesbos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a harbor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now called Caloni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 92, 94, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrheum: <entryFree id="n39781" type="main" key="Pyrrhe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n39781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Ambracia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhia: <entryFree id="n39782" type="main" key="Pyrrhi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a thievish female slave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a comedy of Titinnius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 14</bibl> Schol. Cruq. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhias: <entryFree id="n39783" type="main" key="Pyrrhi^as1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purri/as,</foreign> <sense id="n39783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">commander of the Ætolians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39784" type="main" key="Pyrrhi^a^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <sense id="n39784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*purria/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of the city of Pyrrha in Lesbos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrrhian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhicha: <entryFree id="n39785" type="greek" key="pyrrhi^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhĭcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhĭchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purrixh,</foreign> <sense id="n39785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dance in armor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pyrrhic dance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephas lasciviente pyrrhiche conludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 18</bibl>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars pyrrhicha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 15, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhicharius: <entryFree id="n39786" type="main" key="pyrrhi^cha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhĭchārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">purrhĭch-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pyrrhicha</etym>, <sense id="n39786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who performs the Pyrrhic dance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Pyrrhichist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pyrrhichius: <entryFree id="n39787" type="greek" key="pyrrhi^chi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhĭchĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">purri/xios;</foreign> in prosody, pes, or simply pyrrhichius, <sense id="n39787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical foot consisting of two short syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pyrrhic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:106" default="NO">106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:101" default="NO">101</bibl>; 140 al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 975</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhidae: <entryFree id="n39788" type="main" key="Pyrrhi^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Pyrrhus, I. B.</entryFree>
pyrrho: <entryFree id="n39789" type="main" key="Pyrrho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rrwn,</foreign> <sense id="n39789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Aristotle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the sceptical school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 16, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18, 49</bibl>; 4, 22, 60; 5, 8, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 24</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhōnĕi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ōnĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Pyrrho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pyrrhonists</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhonii philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhocorax: <entryFree id="n39790" type="greek" key="pyrrho^co^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrrhŏcŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">purroko/rac,</foreign> <sense id="n39790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of crow with a reddish beak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Alpine-crow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hermit-crow</hi>: Corvus pyrrhocorax, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl> (al. pyrocorax).</sense></entryFree>
pyrrhonei: <entryFree id="n39791" type="main" key="Pyrrho_ne^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhōnĕi</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhōnĭi</orth>, v. Pyrrho.</entryFree>
pyrrhopoecilos: <entryFree id="n39792" type="main" key="Pyrrho^poeci^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhŏpoecĭlos</orth>, v. Pyropoe-.</entryFree>
pyrrhus: <entryFree id="n39793" type="main" key="Pyrrhus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/rros.</foreign> <sense id="n39793.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Achilles and Deïdamia</hi> (otherwise called Neoptolemus), <hi rend="ital">founder of a kingdom in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain at Delphi by Orestes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 469</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">526</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:123" default="NO">123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 15</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39793.1" n="2" level="3"> Pyrrhi Castra, <hi rend="ital">a place in Laconia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">in Triphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 13</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n39793.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pyrrhĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the kingdom founded in Epirus by Pyrrhus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39793.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> <cb n="PYTH" /> 280 B.C., <hi rend="ital">an enemy of the Romans; on account of his descent from Achilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi> Aeacides (v. h. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 35, 3</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pyrum: <entryFree id="n39794" type="main" key="py^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pyrus</orth>, v. pirum and pirus.</entryFree>
pysma: <entryFree id="n39795" type="greek" key="pysma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pysma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pu/sma;</foreign> in rhet., <sense id="n39795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a question</hi>, Aquila Rom. p. 152 Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
pythagoras: <entryFree id="n39796" type="main" key="Py_tha^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqago/ras,</foreign> <sense id="n39796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated philosopher of Samos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> 550 B.C.; <hi rend="ital">he taught in Lower Italy</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Croton and Metapontum</hi>), <hi rend="ital">and was the founder of the Pythagorean philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which received its name from him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl>.— The Greek letter <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> (called littera Pythagorae), with its two divergent arms, was used by Pythagoras as a symbol of the two diverse paths of life, that of virtue and of vice, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:56" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 56</bibl>; v. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39796.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthăgŏrēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthăgŏrīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqago/reios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Pythagorean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: dogma, Lab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavo,</quote> <trans><tr>into which</tr>, <tr>according to the Pythagorean doctrine of metempsychosis</tr>, <tr>the soul of Euphorbus had passed before it reached Pythagoras</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <trans><tr>highly recommended by Pythagoras</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 78</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 160</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthă-gŏrēi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏrīi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of the Pythagorean philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pythagoreans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n39796.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthăgŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqagoriko/s</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Pythagorean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 86</bibl></cit> (an interpolated passage, v. Sillig in loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">prudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit> (but Pythagorii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 62</bibl> B. and K.; cf. Madv. Opusc. Ac. 1, p. 512).</sense></entryFree>
pythagorisso: <entryFree id="n39797" type="main" key="py_tha^go^risso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳthăgŏrisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqagori/zw,</foreign> <sense id="n39797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to imitate Pythagoras</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pythagorize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster Plato pythagorissat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 352</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pytharatus: <entryFree id="n39798" type="main" key="Pythara_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pytharātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqa/ratos,</foreign> <sense id="n39798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an archon at Athens</hi>, B.C. 270, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 9, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pythaules: <entryFree id="n39799" type="greek" key="py_thaules"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳthaules</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">puqau/lhs.</foreign> <sense id="n39799.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who plays upon the flute the song of the combat between the Pythian Apollo and the dragon Python</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n39799.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">one who plays upon the flute an accompaniment to the</hi> canticum (<hi rend="ital">solo</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of an actor</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl> Obr.</sense></entryFree>
pythaulicus: <entryFree id="n39800" type="main" key="py_thauli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳthaulĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pythaules, II.</etym>, <sense id="n39800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> pythaules, <hi rend="ital">pythaulic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in canticis pythaulicis responsabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
pytheas: <entryFree id="n39801" type="main" key="Pythe^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pythĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n39801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a geographer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Marseilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 75, 77, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 97, 99, § 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pythia: <entryFree id="n39802" type="main" key="Py_thi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae and ōrum</itype>, v. Pythius, sub Python, II. B. 1. and 2.</entryFree>
pythias: <entryFree id="n39803" type="spur" key="Pythias1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pythias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a false reading for Phintias, v. h. v.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n39804" type="main" key="Py_thia^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthiăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n39804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a female slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 47 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in a comedy of Caecilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 238</bibl></cit> Schol. Cruq and Orell.; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 281, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pythion: <entryFree id="n39805" type="greek" key="py_thi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pȳthĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">puqi/wn,</foreign> <sense id="n39805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bulbous plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, Plin 19, 5, 30, § 95 (the correct reading is opitiona).</sense></entryFree>
pythium: <entryFree id="n39806" type="main" key="Pythi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pythĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/qion,</foreign> <sense id="n39806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pythius: <entryFree id="n39807" type="main" key="Py_thi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Python, II.</entryFree>
pytho: <entryFree id="n39808" type="main" key="Py_tho1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳtho</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqw/,</foreign> <sense id="n39808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the former name of Delphi and its environs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 27</bibl> (Python, Müll.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 134</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n39808.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*puqiko/s,</foreign> another form for Pythius, <hi rend="ital">Pythian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n39808.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pu/qios,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Pythian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Delphic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Apollonian</hi>: Delphis prognatus Pythius Apollo, Naev B. P. 2, 20; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also incola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Delphi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 52: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 425</bibl></cit>: vates, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Pythoness</hi>,<pb n="1498" /> <cb n="Q" />  <hi rend="ital">Pythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 199</bibl>; cf. in the foll. —</sense><sense id="n39808.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n39808.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h( *puqi/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the priestess who uttered the responses of the Delphic Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pythoness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n39808.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pȳthĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *pu/qia</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">i(era/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the Pythian games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated at Delphi every fourth year in honor of Appollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 447</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Pythia cantat Tibicen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalicae veniunt ad Pythia laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 409</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
